May be an image of text that says 'Psychology Today American Psychoanalytic Association Psychoanalysis Unplugged When You're So Not Over the Pandemic Strategies √õor coping with Pandemic Trauma and Stress Experience (PTSE). Posted July 7, 2021 Reviewed by Vanessa Lancaster f'.
description:
[Just in] When You're So Not Over the Pandemic ‚Äî Strategies for coping with Pandemic Trauma and Stress Experience (PTSE). You know PTSD, but what is PTSE? PTSE is:
.
1. Difficulty thinking in general, including a loss of focus and attention, on both specific tasks and general goals, and increased mental errors amid the grinding general weariness of pandemic conditions,
.
2. Confusion around the passage of time (minutes, hours, days, weeks) and fuzziness about seasonality (is it spring, summer, fall, or winter?),
.
3. Apathy about things that you typically care about.
.
4. Preoccupation with contracting, or spreading, new Covid variants, or a total lack of concern with your safety and others‚Äô from new variants.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-
>> Pandemic Trauma and Stress Experience (PTSE) presents people with difficulty thinking, confusion, apathy, and a preoccupation with safety.
.
>> Ambiguity and mixed messages from public health experts add to the overall confusion and uncertainty about what the future holds for us.
.
>> Becoming aware of ideas and feelings and recognising some control over them can diminish emotional discomfort.
.
Full article via http://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/psychoanalysis-unplugged/202107/when-youre-so-not-over-the-pandemic
.

description:
[in case you haven‚Äôt heard] Singaporeans are leading healthier lives but experiencing more mental health problems: Survey with staggering insights!
.
>> A majority of Singaporeans are more motivated to be healthy, with 72 per cent of respondents declaring physical health a priority
.
>> They are also spending more time and money on their health
.
>> But 24 per cent of respondents felt anxious and 21 per cent said they were depressed
.
>> Nearly four in 10 respondents said they had considered suicide at some point, with 13 per cent thinking about it at least once a week.
.
Yes, the COVID had made us care more about our physical and mental health, but it has UNEARTHED signs of psychological struggles previously covered up by a lack of awareness and avoidance.
.
Full article @ @todayonline @ https://www.todayonline.com/singapore/singaporeans-leading-healthier-lives-but-experiencing-more-mental-health-problems-survey

May be an image of indoor and text that says 'AINSWORTH MAHLER'.
description:
[so why Ainsworth and Mahler?] At our practice, we have a deep respect of and appreciate the importance of psychological development, as well as an understanding of the ways we relate to significant others in our life.
.
As a way to understand this, we look to two specific areas of development that inform our work, namely Attachment (Mary Ainsworth) and the separation‚Äìindividuation process (Margaret Mahler): Two ways of looking at the mother‚Äìinfant relationship. One can conceptualise the therapeutic relationship as a mental representation of how we learn to resolve our interpersonal and psychological relationships with others. This is a crucial element in the way we advocate for the healing of attachment injuries, since many of our clients had devastating experiences separating and individuating from others in their lives ‚Äî this interplay extends from the time we spend in our mother‚Äôs womb to when we enter our tomb. Just as our clients seek meaning in their experiences, we wish to provide a safe and secure context for those repeated overtures for care, nurturance and understanding. Your needs are kept in mind.
.

description:
Joseph has dysarthria, a motor speech impediment that causes the slurring of words. During his first year at @republicpoly (RP), his Special Education Needs counsellor connected him with SPD's Specialised Assistive Technology Centre where he was assessed for suitable devices, and received training in the use of the Proloquo4Text augmentative and alternative communication (AAC) system. The device allowed Joseph to better express himself as well as effectively conduct his presentations as part of his academic requirements. Joseph was also a guest panelist at our AAC Awareness Month webinar held last October!

Joseph has since graduated from RP and is now a Laboratory Technologist at Temasek Life Sciences Laboratory.

The Third Enabling Masterplan helps us build a caring and inclusive Singapore, where persons with disabilities like Joseph are empowered to be integral and contributing members of society. Read more about the Third Enabling Masterplan via our bio link today!

üì∑ @msfcares 

#SGBudget2021 #InclusiveSG #assistivetechnology #aac #inclusion #republicpoly #msf

Pride Month may be coming to an end but the fight for normality, acceptance and gender inclusivity continues.
.
Seven people from the LGBTQIA+ community in Asia Pacific share some of the questions they asked, and the answers they uncovered, that helped them on their journey to finding pride. Hear their stories of isolation and community, rejection and acceptance, the emphasis on education and de-stigmatisation and the power of unified allyship. They share their stories in the hope of creating a more educated, accepting and happier space for the entire LGBTQIA+ community. #findingpride
.

description:
[are you in it for yourself?] Is Your Emotional Intelligence Authentic, or Self-Serving?
.
Plenty of research has documented manipulative misuses of emotional intelligence ‚Äî the intentionally subtle regulating of one‚Äôs emotions to engineer responses from others that might not be in their best interest. Given that most people aren‚Äôt sociopaths, this article argues, the more common misuses of emotional intelligence are subconscious. To safeguard against inadvertently falling prey to them, we need deeper levels of self-examination. Read the full article to learn three of the more common counterfeits seen that snare well-intended leaders.
.
Via @harvard_business_review @ https://hbr.org/amp/2018/05/is-your-emotional-intelligence-authentic-or-self-serving
.

description:
[Projection: it‚Äôs not me, it‚Äôs you!] People tend to project because they have a trait or desire that is too difficult to acknowledge. Rather than confronting it, they cast it away and onto someone else. This functions to preserve their self-esteem, making difficult emotions more tolerable. It‚Äôs easier to attack or witness wrongdoing in another person than confront that possibility in one's own behavior. How a person acts toward the target of projection might reflect how they really feel about themselves. Sound familiar? 
.
Read the full article @ https://thepsychpractice.com/plog/2021/6/23/projection-its-not-me-its-you
.

[honouring fathers everywhere] Fathering is a unique role specific to the parenting process. Psychologically, it is crucial in our early development that we can distinguish another parent that is separate from our mothers. This duality allows us to form specific relations that we internalise as ways to understand ourselves and being with other people. Thus, no one can replace the crucial role a father plays in forming a paternal object that is sufficiently safe and gratifying in a child‚Äôs mind ‚Äî so that the child can tolerate being away from the secure confines of their mothers. In many instances big and small, it matters how our children experience their fathers and relations with men, including their attitudes toward their kids regardless of age. If you‚Äôre a Dad, it‚Äôs such a privilege to be able to play that role but we acknowledge, is one of the most important roles in your child‚Äôs life that will be deeply influencing for the rest of their lives. This is especially when we can exist in a context where sexist and toxic masculinity undertones are embraced. Happy Father‚Äôs Day to Dads everywhere!
.

World Elder Abuse Awareness Day (WEAAD) takes place on 15 June every year. If you suspect an elderly person is being abused, intervene early and encourage him/ her to call the 24 hour National Anti-Violence Helpline at 1800 777 0000, or make the call on his/ her behalf. 

For more information on elder abuse and WEAAD, please visit the MSF website. 

Elder abuse is not a private matter. Together, we can keep our seniors safe.

Let‚Äôs talk about #fatdieme #fatdieyou 

Just typing those hashtags above, I‚Äôve discovered that there are over 340k posts for the former and 5k posts for the latter, which speaks about how relatively normal this term is. 

I‚Äôm not demanding that everyone should stop using these terms. All I‚Äôm asking is that we put a little more thought into the words we say to ourselves and to others. Do we really mean it?

Remember, we never know who is struggling with disordered thoughts towards food and eating. A joke could cause more harm than we ever intended for it to.

And to everyone reading this, 
It is okay to be fat. It is okay to have more fat than others. It is okay to eat what you want and not feel guilty and ashamed. It is okay to indulge without having to compensate or punish yourself for it. It is okay to be exactly you, in your body, doing what you desire.

Fat is not an insult or used to pass judgment. Fat is a descriptor, like tall, or short. Fat is not a feeling. Stop using fat to guilt or shame yourself or somebody else. 
.
.
.
.
.
.
#eatingdisorderrecovery #eatingdisordersurvivor #edrecovery #eatingdisorderawareness #recoveryispossible #recoverycommunity #bodyacceptance #bodyneutrality  #prorecovery  #singaporeeatingdisorders #mentalhealthawareness #mentalhealth #mentalhealthmatters #singapore #singaporementalhealth

caption: Photo by 195 Pearl Hill CafeÃÅ in 195 Pearl's Hill Terrace with @msfcares, @rickshaw_coffee, @atticfoxsg, and @chefl_195phc. May be an image of one or more people, people sitting and indoor.
description:
‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt look back ‚Äì you just have to put the past behind you, and find something better in your future.‚Äù - Jodi Picoult

Today is a special day for us at 195PHC, as we bid farewell to a father figure who has kindly availed us his street-food skills and experience built up over many decades. Ah Pui's culinary contributions to our community as an individual are significant - satiating tummies, building our heritage, and inspiring others to soldier on amidst adversity.

In our fast-paced, hyperconnected society where achievements, success, and cash are often our kings, Ah Pui embodies an underdog story. A divorcee residing in public rental housing and a recipient of MSF ComCare assistance, Ah Pui is one of the 'invisibles' in Singapore. But despite circumstances, he remains resilient, and adamant in the pursuit of a better future.

At our core, 195PHC is a community F&B incubator - and in our time with Ah Pui, we have convinced him to 'go legal', think bigger, and embrace possibilities. Ah Pui has since found an independent angel investor who has already set up a company with him to take his satay offerings to the next level - and we eagerly await updates!

Two questions on everyone's minds: 

1) Whither the satay? Ah Pui has very kindly gifted the cafe with the full recipe for the satay and sauce, and has passed on the entirety of his skillsets to Ben - so it's business as usual for us as we continue churning out the sticks of indulgent delight!

2) Whither the cafe? Alongside our current F&B offerings which will remain unchanged, we will be bringing in new ones when Phase 2 (HA) concludes. These will continue to build on 195PHC's role as a community incubator.

Thank you Ah Pui - for your contributions, resolve, skills, and satay. While you will be missed dearly, we know The Best is Yet to Be.

Happy to be emcee for @m3atjurong Project S.H.E Volunteers Engagement that was joined by Mdm @rahayumahzam last Saturday morning.

Launched by M3@Jurong, Project S.H.E aims to support and provide assistance to young mothers and mothers-to-be. The committee hope that trained volunteers can not only link these mothers to the various agencies whenever they require assistance and also give them strength, hope and empowerment. 

We are extremely fortunate to live in Singapore where there are existing schemes and available help for these mothers and I got to know more about them through the sharing by staff from @msfcares and @viriya_community_services during the session too. 

Blessed to be part of this meaningful initiative. And of course, thanks for giving me the chance to practise my Malay~! Semoga semua orang faham saya cakap apa! Haha! 

#kitadisini #bilingualemcee

caption: Photo shared by Eric Chua on May 11, 2021 tagging @msfcares, @caresingapore, @singaporecybersports, @ygos_sg, @scys.sg, and @campusimpactsg. May be an image of one or more people and text.
description:
[ Celebrating our Youth Workers ] 

Attended the ‚ÄúYouth Work Day‚Äú event last Fri (7th May), which coincided with the international ‚ÄúThank a Youth Worker‚Äù day! 

In my opinion, Youth Work is often challenging, complex, and many a times, underrated. Yet, the importance of Youth Work cannot be overstated. Youth Workers are oftentimes the lone positive role model, or the only ray of light that young impressionable minds hang on to. 

Yet, rewards that the Youth Worker might savour sometimes do not bloom until years later‚Ä¶. and at times, not at all. Youth Work is a professional practice that requires a commitment, passion, and resilience. Thus, we need to do all that we can to support our Youth Workers. üí™

Happy to have launched the ‚ÄúYouth Work Supervision‚Äù and ‚ÄúYouth Work Mentorship‚Äù Schemes. I thank our experienced youth workers for stepping forward to take on important roles as mentors, and to spur on aspiring youth workers! üôè  @ygos_sg @singaporecybersports @caresingapore @msfcares @scys.sg @campusimpactsg

I'm lucky to have a mother like you for you are the most amazing person in my life.
You never get tired of doing the household stuff repeatedly. 
You prefer loneliness than to have fake company. 
You are the pillar of strength in my most difficult moments. 
You accept my imperfections & love my flaws, because only I own them
You support my present & stand by my back to give me hope and encouragement for the future. 
Whatever you do, was to see me happy.
 
There is no mum like you.

#MustRead Abuse and mistreatment of children has been of great concern in our Society. In 2019, Singapore reported over 1,000 cases of child abuse. Each of these numbers represents a child's life in danger. 

Children as young as infants are the most vulnerable group. This is because they are unable to speak up to seek for help or they may not even realize that they themselves are victims of child abuse. Its time to put an end to it. 

If you are experiencing abuse, or know of someone who is, seek for help and contact the helplines available on the poster.

description:
We believe you!
We support you!
We empower you!

üíô Sexual Assault Awareness Month is an annual public awareness about sexual assault and we see the importance in educating individuals & communities on how to prevent sexual violence.

The Sexual Assault Care Centre (SACC) at @awaresingapore provides services to those who have experienced sexual assault, helping them deal with their experiences and make decisions about their next steps.

üëâüèª Sexual assault (including rape) can be highly traumatic. It can take a long time to recover after such a crime. 

üëâüèæ If you have been a victim of sexual assault, please know that it is not your fault.

üôè Speak up, reach out, seek help today!

Some say not all superheroes wear capes, and we couldn‚Äôt agree more!  A big shout out to the 394 volunteers and partners acknowledged at MSF‚Äôs @msfcares Volunteer and Partner Awards for outstanding contribution to the community.

As a special gifting gesture, MSF commissioned a curated gift for these everyday heroes and heroines. Our choice was the My Little Blue Merlion plate, a perfect representation of the dedication, efforts and energy of each of these amazing volunteers, who help make our community a more inclusive and caring one. This delightful gift commissioned by MSF with the i‚Äômable Collective is produced in limited edition with our makers and partners who bear unparalleled zeal and devotion to their craft in porcelain making.

Thank you @msfcares for your matchless support towards inclusion by collaborating with the i‚Äômable Collective for your gifting series! We look forward to more exciting projects with you.

If you‚Äôre keen to make an impact like @msfcares, join us at imablecollective@sgenable.sg on our enabling journey.

description:
Spousal Abuse is the victimization of an individual resulting from abuse, attacks, or assault undertaken by their respective partners within the parameters of a married relationship. It involves various types of abuse such as physical, psychological & emotional, and/or sexual violence. All it takes is a spark of uncontrolled anger over mismanaged conflicts which will then explode into violent behaviour. Don't let anger get the better of you and allow it to come in between you and your loved ones. 

If you are experiencing abuse, or know of someone who is, seek for help and contact the helplines available on the poster. #enddomesticviolencesg

During the 2020 Circuit Breaker, BMC registered as a Safe Sound Sleeping Place (S3P) with the Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF), to provide shelter to the homeless and displaced.

We housed 6 rough sleepers from 12 May to 1 June.

A big Thank You to:
- The team who worked to get BMC premises ready to MSF‚Äôs detailed standards
- Members who donated lockers and personal items
- Members who readily stepped forward to run the S3P

May BMC continue to reach out to our neighbours in need and inspire others to do the same!

#WeAreBedok #Bedok_MC

description:
There‚Äôre many possible triggers for marital disagreements and my husband and I too have our fair share. While we don‚Äôt always agree, our key to resolution is to always listen ‚Äî it may not happen instantly, especially when tempers flare, but deep in our hearts we know we want to work towards that goal and so on our own we‚Äôll find our way there. Once we‚Äôre calm, we can then have a proper conversation. 

For some couples, it can be hard to be objective and take a step back when tensions mount. That‚Äôs why the Ministry of Social and Family Development @msfcares has partnered with Community Psychology Hub (CPH) to provide online counselling service for those who may be facing marital and parenting stress. It‚Äôs completely free-of-charge and allows for anonymous sign ups. When we address issues early and identify the root cause, we prevent any emotions, that may be irrelevant to the original problem from escalating to a point where resolution becomes impossible. 

If you‚Äôd like someone to talk to or know someone who needs help, head on over to www.cphonlinecounselling.sg!

@familiesforlife #IChooseFamilyTime #CPHonlinecounselling #SingaporeTogether #StrongerAsOneSG

description:
[SWIPE TO READ] Some people may find hope in helping others find it themselves. Sherry, a Therapeutic Case Worker at Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre, recognises the importance of relationships as a vehicle for change and equity. 

Sherry and her colleagues work to empower their clients to be socially responsible and self-reliant, which is a more sustainable approach for their wellbeing in the long run. Though the fruits of their labour might not be immediately apparent, they‚Äôll continue to plant the seeds of empowerment and hope. üå±

What Sherry says about the role of social workers: ‚ÄúWe assess potential clients and allocate resources based on their needs, such as funding or referral to relevant professionals. Social workers address the client‚Äôs concerns while facilitating healing and growth, in order to restore the clients‚Äô relationships with themselves, family, and community.‚Äù
.
.
.
.
#HCSAHappenings #WorldSocialWorkDay #SocialWorkDay #SocialWorkMonth #socialwork #socialworker #socialgood #dogood #sgcares #socialservice #communityservice #socialsupport #cityofgood

AWARENESS POST SERIES 
[MONTH 4] -- HOMELESSNESS

According to a study by CNA, about 1000 people live on the streets of Singapore. The homeless reportedly face health issues and dangers such as theft, and were often often approached and questioned by law enforcement agencies. Homelessness has been a serious and rising issue in Singapore for the past few years yet, are we doing enough for them?

The Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF) safe, sound sleeping places, run by 35 organisations that are existing or potential partners of the Partners Engaging and Empowering Rough Sleepers (Peers) Network, was launched in July 2019. It mainly aims to help and take care of the homeless in Singapore by providing 700 spaces of safe shelters for them. Apart from providing shelters, a daily $15 food allowance is given and also, befrienders will continue to keep in touch with them through calls and texts. 

Should you see anyone in need of shelter, you can reach out to msf_peersoffice@msf.gov.sg or call the ComCare hotline at 1800-222-0000.

#bloomproject #awarenesspostseries #awarenesspost #awareness #homelessness #helpthehomeless #homeless #singaporepoly

description:
The entire month of march is designated as self injury awareness month.

A third of young adults here have self-harmed, with one in 10 doing so frequently, according to a survey released by international research agency YouGov.

It also found that a third of Singaporeans have experienced suicidal thoughts.

There are thoughts who hate, and they divide and they feed off people who don't fight back. Yeah we could laugh this off, but what about the person who can't? Whose gonna help? Silence only make them stronger.

#gridlife.online is participating in #THEORANGEEFFECT campaign because we all need a little help sometimes. We encourage everyone to take this opportunity to talk about self-injury and mental health. Ask the questions everyone else is afraid to ask. Talk about it in a way that is accurate and respectful. Use car meet ups as a good opportunity to engage your peers. It is the best time as everyone is relaxed and enjoying their hobby which could be the one saving their lives from the everyday struggles.

We'll be louder than self-injury. Car enthusiasts and passion is more than just driving cars fast.

‚ù§Ô∏è

Helpline: @samaritansofsingapore

description:
To all you superwomen & wonder women - ‚ÄúBelieve in yourself, even when no one else does YET!‚Äù 

The past few years has been such an insane journey & one exciting surprise after another just pops up. I am an introvert & someone who HATES being in front of the camera. But I know in order to create change, you have to use the voice that you have no matter how small the audience & keep at it. If this resonates with you Be Bold, Stay Inspired & if you want to influence - Influence good & create positive impact.

Beside every woman is another woman supporting her. P. since Day 1 üòò because there are days when I just want to Curl up in a ball(yes I‚Äôll be a darn big ball), bawl my eyes out.  And then She says ‚Äúyou‚Äôve got this Az!‚Äù 

//

I‚Äôm excited to have my story published in Unprecedented: To the Beat of Her Own Drum, a book featuring the stories of 20 young women, uncovering the journeys we took to achieve our own versions of success.

Pledge $25 for a book to celebrate SG Women and raise support for Casa Raudha, a safe shelter for women and children who have experienced domestic violence.

‚ÄúThe important thing about celebrating women is that today, we have the freedom to make our own choices ‚Äì compared to the past when women might not have had this luxury at all.‚Äù - Samantha 

Women make up the majority of the social service sector and continue to bear most caring responsibilities at home. With 2021 declared by @msfcares as the year of #CelebratingSGWomen, we want to recognise all women who have given their all both for their family and the wider society. 

Chrystella and Samantha are two out of many #LadiesWhoLead at HCSA. Chrystella wasn‚Äôt sure where her career path would lead, but it was during a mission trip to China when she felt called to pursue a Masters in Counselling. 

On the other hand, Samantha had made her mind up at a young age that she wanted to work in the social service sector. Even though their initial goals were worlds apart, their paths eventually converged. 

‚ÄúAlthough the social service industry is women-dominated, there are many ladies, like our beneficiaries, who are less privileged and not as fortunate to be able to choose. That‚Äôs why IWD matters to all of us,‚Äù said Samantha. 

‚ÄúI think International Women‚Äôs Day is about celebrating women and our unique contributions. More women are in the workforce now, and most of them are still family-oriented too. 

‚ÄúDRTC staff comprises mostly women and I value the relationships that we have. It spurs us to give our best in our work, for our beneficiaries. We even had to say: ‚ÄúGuys, we can't hang out so much due to COVID-19,‚Äô‚Äù Chrystella said. 

‚ÄúThe late Mr Lee Kuan Yew once said that of his two concerns ‚Äì country and family ‚Äì he looked after the former while his wife cared for the latter. The impact of his wife's contribution really stuck with me,‚Äù Samantha added. 

To all #LadiesWhoLead both at work and at home, thank you for your contributions! üëè

description:
Year 2021 has been declared as the Year of Celebrating SG Women and the Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF) will organise celebrations and activities as part of the women's movement.

I am glad to support national effort to understand Singaporeans‚Äô aspirations and ideas on how we can further advance our women in Singapore.

Is heart-warming that we are celebrating our women's multi-faceted roles across society, and thanks for the men who help to debunk stereotypes, change mindsets and play an active role in supporting and uplifting women. 

Love this logo which inspired by Singapore's national flower, the Vanda Miss Joaquim.

The three silhouettes embedded in the orchid symbol represent the progress of women from the past to the present and into the future, while the spectrum of shades symbolise the diversity of women across generations and backgrounds.

We, as women (be it stay home or working) are doing our best to contribute ourselves to our homes, schools, workplaces and communities ‚Äì improving every aspect of our society. Not an easy journey! Especially for stay-home moms (no cpf, no bonus, no leave, least recognition and likely have to worry for financial and retirement if not able to rely on your loved ones) 

Let us gather together to develop a much caring environment and uplifting one another üíïüí™üèª

Those interested to participate in the upcoming Conversations on Singapore Women's Development may vist this website : 
https://www.reach.gov.sg/participate/conversations-on-singapore-womens-development

There are four men who are allies of women and unafraid to show it. ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
"We will celebrate our women's multifaceted roles across society, and we will also celebrate the men who help to debunk stereotypes, change mindsets and play an active role in supporting and uplifting women," announced by Masagos Zulkifli, Minister for Social and Family Development in January this year.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
Ms Fannie Lim, Executive Director of DOT adds that the men who champion women, whom she had encountered, tend to have strong women in their lives. They had female role models or grew up with single mothers, so they've seen how hard it was.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
Any thoughts on male feminists?‚†Ä
‚†Ä
For full story, go to @straits_times‚†Ä
‚†Ä‚†Ä
#malechampionsofchange #changemakers‚†Ä‚†Ä
#equalopportunity #DOTempower #empoweringwomen #enablingfamilies‚†Ä‚†Ä

description:
I‚Äôve always seen my mum as an incredible person. Not only for the fact that she has brought me up and sacrificed a lot of her own needs for mine, but also how capable she is as an individual. 

She is successful at work (despite her denying it all the time), and is also great at managing our family‚Äôs businesses. She is always keeping a keen eye out for business ventures and giving us tips and advice, to take our business to the next level. I‚Äôve always had great admiration for her as she is able to juggle so many things on her plate every day, especially now that I‚Äôm older and have taken over the family business.

Women are now increasingly being featured in magazines or news publications, and I applaud their great achievements. I find it heartening that they are making waves even in industries that are believed to be male-dominated. It just shows how far we have progressed in our economy and society as a whole. But we have some way to go to educate the masses that the worth of each individual is not dependent on gender.

So let's look forward to greater progress for our women.

Do you too have a woman in life that you look up to or have always admired? Share with me in the comments below!

‚ÄúWe met two years ago when I performed the umrah (an Islamic pilgrimage to Mecca). She was a guide at the travel agency I went with. During the trip, I had a slight fever and she was very concerned. But she's always been responsible at heart ‚Äì she even kept in touch with her groups after umrah.

She used to conduct courses on pilgrimages in the evenings. I‚Äôd pick her up and we‚Äôd go for dinner and talk about our future together. That was our version of dates. And I‚Äôm there for her when she needs me. Even when we were just friends, I'd offer to accompany her parents to their medical visits.

She says that I‚Äôm an easy-going guy, and that the past is the past. As husband and wife now, we have to care for each other and share things with each other. We don‚Äôt keep secrets. This is how we try to build a family.

I made a promise to my late mum that I would be a more responsible person. Back then, she asked, ‚ÄòWhat do you mean by that? You‚Äôve been alone all this while.‚Äô I told her that I wanted to settle down, and she questioned: ‚ÄòAre you sure you are capable of taking on that responsibility?‚Äô 

So I found a girl of my dreams and proved to others, and myself, that I could lead a better life. And I made my mum proud. My family is my pillar ‚Äì we performed umrah together in 2019. They got to know her better and encouraged me to settle down with her. I think it‚Äôs destiny.‚Äù ü•∞üíï

- Deen, HCSA Highpoint alumnus

description:
We should celebrate women every day! They are strong, beautiful and most importantly so so special! So Let 2021 be the year we celebrate SG women! ‚Å£
‚Å£
So I‚Äôm dedicating this post to a superwoman, my mother. She made me believe that women are capable of anything & have the power to run the world only because I grew up watching her possess  immense confidence and strong will!  I have seen my mother fight through all the odds. She never once gave up. Even when times were tough for us financially... she always found a way to provide us the best.  I remember my mother, waking up as early as 4am to head to work. She did odd jobs, just so she can lighten the financial situation at home. She would then come back home and still cook and take care of us .. no matter how tired she was.  Her job required her to be always on the move.. she would come back home with her feet aching. She would soak her legs in warm water for a little while and then she will get back up .. just to attend to us.  She is kind, gentle yet so determined to provide the best for her family. And that always inspires me,till today. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Thank you Amma for always being so selfless! For making me believe that we women are so special and gifted! ‚Å£
‚Å£
Over the years I have seen the role of women in our society amplify! We take on roles, we create our own destiny.. we run the show! LIKE A BOSS! Let‚Äôs continue to celebrate women. Supporting one another and lifting each other higher and higher! ‚Å£
‚Å£
Help build a better, more inclusive society by taking part in the conversation on women‚Äôs development at go.gov.sg/#CelebratingSGWomen @msfcares

She who dared to dream - 
I‚Äôve always admired Liane for many reasons. But perhaps the one that stands out the most is her strong sense of faith and trust even when things aren‚Äôt smooth sailing. Even when the odds weren‚Äôt in her favour. 

In her early primary school days, she struggled with stuttering and that made it hard for her to find her voice... And so she turned to the voice within. Through penning down her thoughts (and so beautifully so I may say), she found an avenue to express herself. 

While it‚Äôs a rough scene for novelists/journalists in Singapore, she found a middle ground in PR where she could still delve in writing but in a more commercial manner. On the sidelines, writing still remains an outlet for her to introspect and reflect on pinnacle moments in her life. With her archive growing, she indirectly prepares to share her work with the world someday.

But I guess what inspires me the most, is how she always comes back to writing. That flame that burns so brightly in spite it all, as something that keeps her grounded and more importantly, alive. 

And to that, I‚Äôd like to say, thank you for daring to dream and I can‚Äôt wait for the day your dream comes to fruition. x

Coda, This Room And The Next, and When Maps Fail by Liane Seow. 
‚Ä¢
Join me in celebrating the women who dare to dream by taking part in the Conversations on Singapore Women‚Äôs Development at go.gov.sg/sgwomen. Let‚Äôs build a more inclusive society together.  #CelebratingSGWomen @msfcares

description:
When I was a kid, my parents were busy with work and couldn't spend much time with us. My elder sis had to assume the responsibility of taking care of my younger sister and I, when she was only a few years older than us. 

Growing up, she often cooked for us, helped us with our homework, and did all the other household chores (while making sure we did our fair share of them too). 

Even now, when my parents are not able to celebrate Chinese New Year in Singapore together with us this year, she has been planning and finding ways to organise a virtual celebration all on her own, so that we can still feel connected to our parents at home, and bask in the festivities together as a family, no matter where we are. 

I can‚Äôt imagine what my life would be like without her. If I were in her position, I don‚Äôt think I would have known what to do. I can't thank her enough for looking after us all these years, and always being there for us, as our elder sister

description:
2021 is the year we Celebrate SG Women and there‚Äôs this one person who I really want to celebrate. The woman figure whom I look up to.. my mom! ü•∞ 

My mom has always been someone who is there for others. One incident I remember vividly was when her close friend was diagnosed with breast cancer. She stood by her throughout, keeping her company, and running her day-to-day errands. Most importantly, she was a great pillar of emotional support, making it a point to let her friend know that she‚Äôll always be there to listen. She encouraged her to stay positive, and press on with her battle against cancer till the very end.

As the saying goes, a friend in need is a friend indeed, and my mum is truly someone I know I can always fall back on, even when the going gets tough. I was particularly inspired by this incident, as it also showed me that incredible things can happen, when women support each other.

As we celebrate SG Women this year, I hope we can all shift mindsets to foster a more inclusive society for both men and women. üôåüèª

We‚Äôve come far but there‚Äôs more to be done! Let us help to build a better society by taking part in the Conversation on Singapore Women‚Äôs Development at go.gov.sg/sgwomen. #CelebratingSGWomen @msfcares

caption: Photo by DESMOND TAN ÈôàÊ≥ÇÊ±ü in Singapore with @msfcares.
description:
When I was in school, my teacher introduced me to this memoir "Sold for Silver" by Janet Lim, and I was inspired by her remarkable life story. 

In the 1930s, Janet was sold for $250 as a mui sui, or slave girl from China to Singapore, when she was only 8 years old. 

She eventually freed herself from child bondage by making her own escape, and was later taken into a girls' home. She then went on to receive education in a mission school, and later joined St Andrew's Mission Hospital as a nurse. 

During World War II, she was captured by the Japanese and made a ‚Äòcomfort woman‚Äô. Thankfully for her, she managed to escape once again, and returned to nursing at St Andrew's. 

Not long after, Janet became Singapore's first Asian hospital matron, and the first woman in Singapore to publish a book in English. 

I am awed by Janet‚Äôs grit and tenacity in overcoming the odds and rising above adversity to change the course of her life. To me, she is a true inspiration to many women (and men alike) of our future generations - nothing is impossible if one sets out to achieve it. 

This year, join me in celebrating SG Women and show appreciation for all the wonderful women in your life! üíô 

Let‚Äôs take part in the Conversations on Singapore Women‚Äôs Development at go.gov.sg/sgwomen, and build a better, more inclusive society. 
 
#CelebratingSGWomen @msfcares

She Who Is All Of Us 

A woman figure whom I look up to is definitely my mom. Apart from her work, she didn‚Äôt have anyone to help her with house chores, and had to raise my siblings and I all on her own. Yet, she never once complained about it. 

Now that I am a mother too, I can fully understand how difficult those days must have been for her, and I really admire and appreciate her for all that she has done for us. 

I feel very blessed to have her help me out with taking care of my kids now, as it allows me time to focus on my career. 

To me, all mothers, regardless of whether they work inside or outside the home, deserve to be given the recognition for their contributions to society. A salute to all moms! 

Join me in building a better, more inclusive society by taking part in the conversation on women‚Äôs development at go.gov.sg/SGWomen

description:
I look at this photo and I am thankful. Thankful for this blissful marriage and happy family even in the face of this pandemic, Alhamdulliah. It is something that I will not take for granted knowing that there are others out there who are facing marital and parenting challenges because of COVID-19. In these situations, one would feel stressed and overwhelmed and it is ok to rely on others for support. Family wellness starts with your own wellbeing.

The Ministry of Social and Family Development, @msfcares has worked with the Community Psychology Hub to provide a free online counselling service. If you know of a loved one or friend facing marital or parenting concerns, visit www.cphonlinecounselling.sg to find out more. All sessions are confidential, and your identity will be kept anonymous.

@familiesforlife

description:
As we come to the end of a most unusual year, everyone learns to cope in a different way. Our family had to adapt not only to Covid times, but also a new baby to the family. I‚Äôm blessed to have immense family support through this period.

The Ministry of Social and Family Development @msfcares has worked with the Community Psychology Hub to provide free online counselling service to help those struggling to cope in these tumultuous times.

Seeking help is also a way of loving your family. If you are facing challenges in your family, be it marital, divorce or parenting issues, visit www.cphonlinecounselling.sg to find out more. All sessions are confidential and your identity will be kept anonymous.

Help spread the word too with the hashtag #CPHonlinecounselling - it may reach someone in need ‚ù§Ô∏è

@familiesforlife

description:
This is a family portrait drawn by Ale when she was 5 years old‚Ä¶ although it may not look like it. üòÇ But I think this illustrates the point that for young children at least, family means the world to them and having a safe, stable and nurturing place to call home is just as important.

Which is why fostering is a remarkable way to make a big difference in a young person‚Äôs life. Becoming a foster parent means providing an alternative care arrangement for children who are below 18 years of age, who have been abused, neglected or abandoned.Even though it comes with challenges, it also provides immense intangible rewards and satisfaction, as I found out through my interviews with afoster parent and a Senior Foster Care Officer.

And I‚Äôm glad I did so because I cleared up some of my misconceptions about fostering in Singapore too! Head to cheekiemonkie.net for my article, or click link in my bio.

#FosterAChildSG #LetsTalkAboutFostering

DID YOU KNOW? 

An Advanced Medical Directive (AMD) & Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) can be drawn up for free by all Singaporeans above 21 years old and with the mental capacity to do so. 

Talking about death can sometimes seem morbid or difficult especially in Asian cultures, but why not look at it from the angle of being prepared for any future medical crises and saving your family unnecessary distress at an already difficult time? 
. 
. 
Credits 
Excepts: 
https://www.bethelfunerals.com.au/how-to-be-remembered-through-a-legacy/ 

AMD - https://www.moh.gov.sg/policies-and-legislation/advance-medical-directive 

LPA - https://www.msf.gov.sg/opg/Pages/The-LPA-The-Lasting-Power-of-Attorney.aspx

Chapter 1: Coalblooded is the first chapter of our brand new series "CINEMPATHY IN MOTION" where we aim to cover the emotional and mental experiences of people from different walks of life. 

Physical and drug abuse is the main content of "Coalblooded" where such issues are still prevalent in today times. In Singapore, as much as we have done a great job in clamping down on these, it still happens and sometimes, unknowingly. 

We believe physical and drug abuse are never one off but collated small, subtle and unknowing choices that resulted as such. 

Like allowing your partner to get away with disrespecting you with words, followed by physically pushing you, slapping you and eventually hurting you.üëä

Like allowing your peers to insist you on taking something "fun" like weed because everyone is doing it, followed by happy pills and eventually trying something worse. üíä

Sometimes, a call for help seems weak but to us, it is one of the most courageous thing to do. We applaud those who have gone through such times and even when it seems like there's no hope, they stand up and get out of the tunnel. And we hope the same for anyone going through the same thing. 

Help is available as long as you reach your hands out. üßë‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüßë

If you are going through a tough time, comment below or DM us. We promise to lend a listening ear. üëÇ

#firstdancestudio #firstdancestudiosg #FDSSG

Searching for mental health services can be really stressful and confusing, so we‚Äôve compiled a list of free or affordable mental health resources in Singapore! üå±

The resources can be split into 2 different types: free services and paid services.

Free services include hotlines and CHAT‚Äôs mental health check. Please note that these are for emergency help or mental health assessment, and ùóîùó•ùóò ùó°ùó¢ùóß counselling services! Paid services include counselling services and government mental healthcare. 

It‚Äôs unfortunate that many choose not to seek mental health treatment due to financial reasons. In creating this list, we hope to shine a light on resources that are more wallet-friendly. 

.
.
.

Introducing ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs the Teh ‚òïÔ∏è‚Äù - a new series revolving around mental health in relation to current affairs!! stay tuned every Sunday for more ü§üüèªü§©

description:
Fewer couples in Singapore got married and more marriages ended in divorce last year.

A total of 25,434 marriages were registered in 2019, 5.8 per cent lower than the 27,007 marriages registered in 2018.

Over a five-year period, however, the annual average number of marriages registered rose to 27,389 from the 26,844 seen between 2010 and 2014.

Source: https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/singapore/fewer-marriages-more-divorces-2019-singapore-singstat-12968970

description:
Fun Facts about Registry of Muslim Marriages‚Äô logo!

‚Ä¢ The acronym 'T' and 'U' (which represents the theme, Tranquility in Unity) are translated stylishly into an Islamic-looking logo through Jawi writing which is basic Muslim calligraphy.

‚Ä¢ The two dots in the logo symbolically represent the partnership between a man and his wife in achieving the theme (Tranquility in Unity) together .

‚Ä¢ The blending of blue and green projects natural harmony that is achieved within an analogous colour scheme.

Muhasabah Masyarakat bersama Mufti 2020 is proudly supported by Registry of Muslim Marriages. 

Don‚Äôt forget to watch Muhasabah Masyarakat bersama Mufti 2020 on 26 September at 7.40 pm live on Muslim SG Facebook Page:  https://www.facebook.com/MuslimSG/ & on SalamSG TV: go.gov.sg/salamsgtv

description:
Muhasabah Masyarakat bersama Mufti 2020 is proudly supported by M3.

M3 is a collaborative effort between three key community institutions ‚Äî Islamic Religious Council of Singapore (Muis), MENDAKI and MESRA.

It aims to build a Community of Success by:

‚Ä¢ Supporting citizen-centric and last-mile help for social and educational programmes, reaching families in need;

‚Ä¢ Serving the needs and aspirations of the Malay/Muslim community;

‚Ä¢ Encouraging individuals to step forward to help and promote impactful community programmes; and

‚Ä¢ Bringing together professionals and community leaders to contribute in local neighbourhoods, strengthening families and our next generation.

Don't forget to watch Muhasabah Masyarakat bersama Mufti 2020 on 26 September at 7.40 pm live on Muslim SG Facebook Page:  https://www.facebook.com/MuslimSG/ & on SalamSG TV: go.gov.sg/salamsgtv 
 
#3M2020 #SingaporeTogether #MajuBersamaM3 #SGUnited #SGTeguhBersatu #SalamSGTV

To all those who are silently fighting battles we don‚Äôt know about, I hope this information can help you if necessary. ‚Å£
‚Å£
The COVID-19 Support Grant will be extended to Dec 2020 to help Singaporeans who are unemployed or have suffered significant income loss.‚Å£
‚Å£
First-time applicants who meet the current eligibility criteria may continue to apply for the grant until 6pm on Sep 30. ‚Å£
 ‚Å£
From Oct 2020, both existing recipients and new applicants can apply for the grant.‚Å£
‚Å£
For more info you can refer to: go.gov.sg/jobssupport

description:
A whole semester is done, final exams are looming and we spend countless hours burning the midnight oil to prepare for one of the biggest moments in our lives. As we do that for our education, we also need to be prepared with sound knowledge before marriage. What is that knowledge? Why is it important? 

We invite you to join us in this discussion at Muhasabah Masyarakat bersama Mufti 2020 on Friday, 26 September at 7.40 pm live onMuslim SG‚Äôs Facebook Page:  https://www.facebook.com/MuslimSG/ & on SalamSG TV: go.gov.sg/salamsgtv .

description:
She had strict , traditional Asian parents but she went on to plan and execute shoplifting sprees for the thrill. When we discussed about youth crimes in Episode 68 , we noted that lack of parental supervision is one of the factors that contribute to youths committing crime. 
.
. 
But this episode proved otherwise. So where does the fault lie?
.
.
Tune in to Episode 70 of The Onion Aunties on Spotify. 
.
Share your views with us. 
.
.
#podcast #podcastlife #podcastersofinstagram #youthcrime #crimeprevention #singaporepoliceforce #minlawsg #sglaw

It is almost a rite of passage in life where you study, work and then get married and create a family. But have you ever wondered, ‚ÄúWhat is the significance of marriage in Islam? What is the hikmah behind the union of two people?‚Äù 

SS Ustaz Dr Naziruddin seeks to explore the spiritual and religious aspects of marriage, and in understanding the responsibilities entrusted towards the couple in building a family and making it work.

description:
Yayasan Mendaki (Council for the Development of Singapore Malay/Muslim Community) is a pioneer Self-Help Group formed in 1982 dedicated to empower the community through excellence in education, in the context of a multi-racial and multi-religious Singapore.

The Raikan Ilmu festival, or celebrate knowledge festival, will be taking some of the activities online and to the television screens this year, in light of social distancing requirements.

Among the activities that will be conducted by Mendaki will be an online mass reading event, a job fair that will include virtual career guidance workshops at selected Workforce Singapore (WSG) satellite centres across Singapore, and a dialogue session with the Institute of Policy Studies (IPS).

Muhasabah Masyarakat bersama Mufti 2020 is proudly supported by Yayasan Mendaki ( @mendakisg ). 

Catch Muhasabah Masyarakat bersama Mufti 2020 on 26 September at 7.40 pm live on Muslim SG Facebook Page:  https://www.facebook.com/MuslimSG/ & on SalamSG TV: go.gov.sg/salamsgtv

‚ÄúA society which does not recognise the equal position of women is a society which can never live up to its potential ‚Äì even more so in Singapore, where people are our only assets.‚Äù

I stand behind this quote by Minister @kshanmugam_ which he shared at the ‚ÄúConversations on Women Development‚Äù dialogue this morning. It was my great pleasure to join my Parliamentary colleagues @sun.xueling and @rahayumahzam ¬†in this virtual discussion on women-related issues in Singapore.

Today‚Äôs discussion marks the start of a series of engagements that MSF, with support from MCCY and MHA, will be organising to engage the public on women-related issues. I am heartened to hear from the personal experiences of Singaporeans, particularly our youth from different background and causes (i.e. CYGO Youth Advisory Group, Mendaki Club, NEBO, etc), their thoughts on women-related issues, and what more we can do as a society. Views and feedback gathered from these engagements will be presented as a White Paper in Parliament in 2021.

Xue Ling, Rahayu and I would like to hear more from you ‚Äì women and men alike ‚Äì on this matter. Your feedback can help to shape programmes, policies, and legislation in Singapore to better support and uplift women. We are at the cusp of positive change, and I encourage you to partner with us in our efforts to create a better society for all.¬†

Minister's keynote speech is available on @mhasingapore 's website.

description:
Fun Facts about Registry of Muslim Marriages‚Äô logo!

‚Ä¢ The acronym 'T' and 'U' (which represents the theme, Tranquility in Unity) are translated stylishly into an Islamic-looking logo through Jawi writing which is basic Muslim calligraphy.

‚Ä¢ The two dots in the logo symbolically represent the partnership between a man and his wife in achieving the theme (Tranquility in Unity) together .

‚Ä¢ The blending of blue and green projects natural harmony that is achieved within an analogous colour scheme.

Muhasabah Masyarakat bersama Mufti 2020 is proudly supported by Registry of Muslim Marriages.

it is not weak of you to fall;
it is not wrong for you to speak
¬¨
Do you feel like nobody will hear your heart's cry? Look around you, for the shoulder you can lean on! We all need somebody. ‚ô•Ô∏è
.
.
.
#ThroughTheNight #HopeThroughTheNight #suicidehasnogender #suicidepreventionawareness  #suicidepreventionmonth #mentalhealthawareness #normalizementalhealth #destigmatizementalillness #youarenotalone

I hear you. You are worthy. There is help available.
¬¨
As suicide prevention week comes to a close, I wanted to gift this to those who need go hear it...You are worthy the way you are. Nothing more or less you have to do to be inherently valuable. THERE IS HOPE STILL üòå you can get through this present moment...#ThroughTheNight.
Although I don't and cannot understand what you're going through, I promise as you put one foot in front of the other, you'll realise when you look back just how far you've come. * hug *
. 
Please reach out if you need to speak to someone!
@samaritansofsingapore (24/7): 1800 221 4444
@msfcares National CARE (8-12am) : 1800 202 6868
IMH hotline: 6389 2222
¬¨
While painting this, I thought of how oftentimes, the shroud of darkness we may be trapped in could mean that those around us who are well-intentioned or genuinely wanting to extend empathy and a listening ear cannot reach (into) us at all.  The loud inner (or monsters') voices  drown the distant sounds out and sometimes nothing helps. There are moments where we get tired of fighting the voices, and those are the times we really feel like giving up. Yet we have been brave before, and we are brave now. As we find ourselves passing through a next second, minute, hour, dawn, dusk...It's another little victory to celebrate üí™üèª hooray. We will begin again. One day at a time.
.
.
.
#hopethroughthenight #suicideprevention #suicidepreventionawareness #suicidehasnogender #mentalhealth #destigmatizementalillness #normalizementalhealth

Domestic violence can impact anyone, anywhere and due to isolation, we‚Äôre seeing an increase.
Join @thebodyshopsg, as they‚Äôre working with @nomoreorg @msfcares, to amplify their advice on how to help if you‚Äôre worried about someone and want to help combat the rise in domestic violence.
- If you feel someone is at risk of domestic violence, follow your instinct and offer help.
- If you see or hear an abusive situation, try figure out how to intervene safely. If the situation seems dangerous, don‚Äôt handle it yourself, get help from 999 or SMS the Police at 71999 immediately.
- If a friend confides in you, create a code word or sign so you know when help is needed.
- While supporting, help them develop a plan to stay safe, including where to go, items to take and emergency numbers like 999.
- Learn about domestic violence. Abuse isn‚Äôt always physical. Verbal and emotional abuse is still domestic violence.
- Help prevent domestic violence by speaking to your children and teaching them about healthy, respectful relationships.

It‚Äôs time to reach out. Share this post and tag 3 other friends and help more people take action.

#IsolatedNotAlone #BreakTheSilence

description:
Singapore's Social Media has reached a stage where victims feel safe and supported enough to speak out about their experiences and perpetrators. It has taken a long time, but after a lot of work, many brave people have come out to share their stories.
+
It is important for us as a community to hear their voices and validate their experiences. It is important for us to hold predators accountable for the injustice that they have done. And it is just as important for us to know where we can refer our friends and family to when they call out for help.
+
I hope that even if you have never been a victim, you can familiarise yourself with some of these resources, so that if anyone approaches you for help, especially during this time, you know where they can go to seek professional help.
+
If you are a victim, then you are incredibly strong. But please know that you don't have to be strong alone. You can share your burdens. There are people who will believe you and hear you out. There is a chance for things to get better for you. Good luck.
+
*Please note that I shortened long URLs using tinyurl.com. If they do not work, you can try googling key words and the site you are looking for should be the first to pop up. I have also tagged the organisations in each post and I hope you can find the information you need there!

.
This Father's Day, we celebrate the friendship and support among fellow dads like that of Ronald and Sean. We got to know Ronald after his wife's fatal accident left him as a single father to two young sons. He was matched with our volunteer Sean, a single father himself, who has journeyed with Ronald and his kids since.
.
.
.

Swipe to find out how your support has made an impact the past couple of months! While it's been a trying period for many, we are encouraged by the generosity of Singaporeans like yourself who have come forward to support those in need ü•∞
.
To date, we have raised $18,025 to support single-parent families, ex-offenders, and teenage girls recovering from trauma.
.
Your donations have and will continue to provide them with:
- Supermarket vouchers to purchase groceries, toiletries and other essentials
- Prepaid top-up cards to stay in touch with their loved ones
- E-readers which function as a helpful engagement and learning tool
- Delivery of groceries and fresh food during this transitory period
- EZ Link card top-ups for essential workers to retain their jobs and for those required to go for job interviews to secure new employment.
.
As we ease out of the circuit breaker, our fundraising page will remain open as HCSA continues to help these vulnerable groups adjust to a new normal.
.
You can contribute to our cause by clicking the link in our bio or visiting 'giving.sg/hcsa/safeathome'.

description:
Social distancing is serious business at NTUC First Campus‚Äô My First Skool! It is practiced and adhered to by parents and children alike when dropping off at, or fetching from the centre.‚Å£
‚Å£
There are aplenty visuals and signs to help us with this and Bray demonstrates in the cover pic. He was so excited to return to school, in a mask no less! Within the centre, many similar signs were also put up to remind the children to do their part. This I'm assured of as the Centre Principal and his teachers had already briefed us ahead the previous Friday via a private zoom session with us parents before school even started. Also, My First Skool even developed a back-to-school kit with lots of tips and activities for transiting from home back to schools! We highly recommend that you read it with your child too! (Go to https://bit.ly/mfs-back-to-school-kit #linkinbio!)‚Å£
‚Å£
I especially want to thank how My First Skool supported us in preparing Bray for back-to-school. I mean, sure, we can do endless activities revolving around covid-19 (also part of his home based learning), but nothing beats a special tea time his teachers organised in the week before school reopened.‚Å£
‚Å£
They put on their uniform, login zoom at the designated timing, smashed up some eggs together, made themselves sandwiches and milk, and chanted their same before-meal cheer which they always do together in school!‚Å£
‚Å£
For the children, it was an awesome catch up with each other over their self-made tea snacks. For me as I saw it, it was a seamless simulation of how school has always been - their patient teachers guiding them through their hands-on activities together, and the camaraderie in class that has always been there. What better way to make them look forward to go back to school!‚Å£
‚Å£
Registrations are now open till June 2021*! Sign up with NTUC First Campus‚Äô My First Skool today to experience their quality and holistic education! #linkinbio‚Å£ (https://bit.ly/belanbray-mfsbacktoschool)
‚Å£
‚Å£

[The Downside of Couple Quarantine]
Most people see working from home as a positive, that you get to spend more time with your partner, the first person you see in the morning, the last person at night and also everything in between. Considering most of us don‚Äôt live in a mansion where you get your own personal space; a darker and less talked about side of couple quarantine is how the time spent together also gives rise to the potential risk of conflict. With varying styles in handling different situations, daily small annoyance can quickly escalate to a full blown war. We all need to understand that we are all strangers in these unprecedented times. With the added pressure of work uncertainties and the inability to head out to do what we want, we are all feeling it regardless if we put it out there anot. It‚Äôs also in these times that we all need to learn to be a little bit more patient to the people around. Let the situation draw us closer rather than pull us apart. Let us all learn to be abit more giving and understanding towards each other - for as a couple, it‚Äôs never you against them, it‚Äôs always going to be you against the world. Learn to let the little things go for it‚Äôs the bigger picture of being together that‚Äôs truly worth fighting for. Stay hopeful, stay strong and when we all pull through this together, this period would be one of the stories we tell our kids for the ages.
#sgunited #stayhomesg

{Counselling services offering support for families and individuals during COVID-19}‚Å£
‚Å£
TL;DR‚Å£
FREE counselling help/support:‚Å£
- for marital/divorce/parenting issues‚Å£
üëâ www.cphonlinecounselling.sg‚Å£
- for mental wellness/marital/parenting support‚Å£
üëâ National CARE Hotline at 1800-202-6868‚Å£
‚Å£
======================================‚Å£
‚Å£
During this period where families are staying home and spending more time with one another, relationships can be strained and there is a possibility that frictions may occur if there are underlying tensions or new anxieties and concerns to arise.‚Å£
‚Å£
@msfcares Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF) has worked with the #CommunityPsychologyHub to provide online counselling at¬†www.cphonlinecounselling.sg.¬†This FREE service supports people with marital, divorce or parenting issues. Anyone who is feeling stressed or anxious are encouraged to step forward and seek help early by talking to the counsellors at CPH Online Counselling via live chat or email.‚Å£
‚Å£
Apart from the CPH Online Counselling service, there is also the #NationalCAREHotlineSg at 1800-202-6868 alongside other community helplines offering mental wellness and marital parenting and counselling support.‚Å£
‚Å£
Seeking help early is important, along with supporting each other so that we can overcome the crisis and strengthen our family life.¬†#‚ù§Ô∏è‚Å£
‚Å£
‚Å£
P.S. #Enacted pics; no mama nor child was harmed in the process of these pic taking. All hair and face features remain intact. Both mama and child were laughing hysterically while reviewing their takes. Son gave away and broke into a smile by the third pic - did you notice? üòÜ‚Å£
‚Å£
P.S.S. It's ok not to be ok. ‚Å£
Sometimes, we just need to wind down and chill. Sometimes, we just need to slow down. Sometimes, if all fails, it's ok to ask for help. ‚Å£
Stay safe, stay well, stay sane üíïüôå‚Å£
‚Å£
‚Å£
#notasponsoredpost but thank you @ninemerpr for helping to #spreadtheword‚Å£!

description:
With the more frequent eruptions between couples as families are forced to stay home together during this circuit breaker period, please DO NOT resort to domestic violence (as staged in the photo)üëé‚ùåüôÖüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüôÖüèª
.
.
A quick tip in the case of a major quarrel: Take a deep breath to blow off some steam üò§ and walk away from the other party. If the situation doesn‚Äôt get any better, consider sleeping alone in the hammock or sofa in the living room at night üòÑ‚ú®‚ù§Ô∏èüí™
.
.
#saynotodomesticviolence #familymatters #sgunited

[ùó¶ùó™ùóúùó£ùóò ùóßùó¢ ùó•ùóòùóîùóó] While Natasha and Feroz may have different experiences, these experiences have shaped the way they view and appreciate 'family'. Family is something we take for granted, but these two individuals remind us of it's importance.
.
We were privileged to invite both beneficiaries to give their testimonies at last year's Night of Hope Gala; and in light of International Day of Families today, we wanted to share them again with you!
.
(L) Natasha is an alumni of HCSA Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre. Growing up, she went through episodes of abuse, depression and anxiety. This led to her to attempt suicide twice. But things started to change after she came to Dayspring and learned what it felt like to be accepted and heard.
.
(R) Feroz is an alumni of HCSA Highpoint Halfway House. As a husband and father, he felt helpless in prison when he and his wife got divorced and his children were far away. He was determined to get back to his family after his release and with Highpoint's support, he did. He now looks forward to go back to family at the end of each day.
.
.
.
.
.

description:
I didn‚Äôt grow up with Barbie Dolls nor play ‚Äòmasak-masak‚Äô with toy kitchen sets like most little girls but would rather lose myself in a world of books, paints and brushes. The only ‚Äútoy‚Äù I played with was my paper doll which my Mom made for me. She taught me how to draw and make a few pieces of clothing for the paper doll but I bet she didn‚Äôt expect that I ended up making hundreds of outfits. Probably that was an early sign of my affinity with fashion illustration.
.

It was one of my fondest memories of my childhood and my time spent with my Mom.  So when the Ministry of Social and Family Development @msfcares asked if I can help to create some art activities that can help families bond together as we all stay home in our fight against Covid-19, I just knew that making paper dolls would be one of them. So here‚Äôs a video showing you how you can make your very own paper doll. 
To download my paper doll template, go to the link in my bio above.

If you love fashion and perhaps dreamt of being a fashion designer or stylist, you would love this. Stay home, stay creative!‚ù§Ô∏è .
This is part of the #FriendsofFFLShare series which feature videos and content from other Friends of FFL volunteers. @familiesforlife.

#StayHomeForSg #SgTogether #FamilyStaySafe #FriendsofFFLShare #SGUnited #StaySafe #StayHome

Domestic Abuse - Helplines.

Around the world, there have been reports of increased domestic violence during periods like these.

If you are suffering from domestic abuse, or witnessing domestic abuse, these are the things you can do.

1. Call the @singaporepoliceforce at 999, or go to your nearest neighbourhood Police Post or Center. If you cannot speak freely on the phone, send an SMS to the police at 71999.

2. We have just set up the National CARE Hotline at 6202 6868. You can call this number if you need emotional support.

You can also call these other hotlines, for specific help.

MSF Child Protective Service (@msfcares)
1800-777-0000

PAVE (@paveorg)
6555 0390

TRANS SAFE Centre
6449 9088

AWARE Women's Helpline (@awaresingapore)
1800 777 5555

description:
It has not been easy on any of us.

Isolation, social distancing and extreme changes in daily life are hard now, but Singapore also needs to be prepared for what may be an epidemic of clinical depression because of COVID-19.

We do not wish to be the bearers of bad news. But this crisis, and our response to it, will have psychological consequences. 
Individuals, families and communities need to do what they can to support the mental health of everyone around us.

Most of us know the emotional attributes of depression: sadness, irritability, emptiness and exhaustion. 
Given certain conditions, these universal experiences influence our mind and transform it, reducing  motivation and disrupting sleep, appetite and attention. 
Depression lays waste to our capacity to problem-solve, set and achieve goals and function effectively.

What can we do ? It‚Äôs time to take ACTion. 
#mentalhealth #covid19 #singapore #mentalactsg #depression #asia

By today, most of you would have received your one-off $600 Solidarity Payment. If you are not in need of this, we seek your support in donating just $50 or $100 of this payout to support these 4 vulnerable groups we serve.
.
The current outbreak has adversely affected our fundraising activities and we are bracing ourselves for a shortfall of about $500,000. With your donation, we can continue running our programmes and services these individuals and families!
.

description:
Anxiety comes in various forms. No one is a problem. 
Anxiety is something that visits us. Sometimes it stays for a brief moment. 
Sometimes it might be the annoying relative who might just a tiny bit longer. 
With the COvid19 situation, it‚Äôs okay to feel anxious or fearful of what‚Äôs going to happen and what‚Äôs happening. 
It‚Äôs okay to feel that way. It‚Äôs okay to feel anxious.

We are here for you. Mental ACT is here for you. 
Call us or text us to talk about your anxiety. 96193531 or 97769067. 
We have trained professionals who are here to listen and provide you with the space to share your problems.

description:
Hey everyone,
During these pressing times , a number of Indians have reached out for counselling  and befriending as they grapple with family and work situations and fear the Covid19 situation. 
Anxiety levels within community has risen and people are feeling anxious and depressed. 
We would like to extend our services (pro-bono) to anyone (Indian / Non-Indian) who needs someone to talk to. Its a safe space, and full confidenality will be maintained. 
If u are facing something and you need someone to talk to,we are here. 
Call or WhatsApp us at 9619 3531 or 9776 9067. 
Team Mental ACT

description:
And so, at last, the lockdown has reached Singapore's shores. How do you survive the parentocalypse in a dense city-state like ours?
.
.
Over the past two months, I've been trying to work with three kids by my side (1 baby and 2 preschoolers). Here's my verdict on materials that: (1) require minimal parent involvement, (2) involve minimal mess, and (3) keep the little people busy for a long time. (Also see my previous post for a psychologist‚Äôs parenting tips.)
.
.
#SupportLocalBusinesses
If you're thinking of purchasing things, please support local businesses during this time! At the moment, my go-to shop is: @ourartstudio.sg (The owner will even WhatsApp you with recommendations.)
.
.
.
.
.

Swipe to meet Kartigah and Yuni - three mothers who are now living purposeful lives and working towards financial independence!
.
But with care-giving duties on their plate, this wasn't always the case. In fact, both mothers faced difficulties in finding suitable job opportunities to earn an income.
.
We started seeking out work and training opportunities that they could benefit from, and empowered them with the confidence and skills to realise their potentials. Kartigah was linked up with E&S Blessing's Celebrating Dreams mentoring initiative (@esblessingbox), while Yuni started on a training programme with Bettr Barista (@bettrbarista).
.
Today, we are encouraged to see both mothers pursuing these opportunities and value-adding their lives!
Click the [link in our bio] to help change the lives of more single mothers like them! or visit www.giving.sg/hcsa/EmpowerSingleParents.
.
All donations are eligible for 250% tax deduction.
.
.
.

description:
Stoked to bring friends of Superhero Me together to kickstart this series of community talks and networking sessions at @professorbrawn to improve our collective knowledge of inclusion. Let's talk about Inclusive Early Childhood Education over dinner with on 13 Feb, featuring Ow Yang Jing Yi, Principal of Canossaville Preschool, Tee Yi Senior Early Interventionist & Programme Coordinator at Rainbow Centre, Singapore and Winnie Soh, Preschool Teacher at Kindle Garden by AWWA. This talk is suitable for those interested to know more about what it's like to work with preschoolers with special needs or learn more about inclusion in a preschool setting. .

P/S: You pay for your dinner, we dish the knowledge. Sign up at bit.ly/supertakeaway :)

description:
"I was going through a difficult divorce which left me aimless in life, not knowing what to do. I was clueless on how to move on as a single mother of two young kids.
.
At first, I didn't have much confidence in myself and I was concerned about caregiving arrangements should I start working on a regular basis. But my neighbour introduced me to SPIN and things changed.
.
Jeanne (my social worker) and Yani (my ally volunteer) from SPIN believed in my potential and constantly encouraged me to try something new, take up a course, or learn a skill. They even took the next step to provide me with available options and discussed job/training opportunities that I could benefit from.
.
With their support, I am currently pursuing a Holistic Training Programme with Bettr Barista (@bettrbarista @bettr.group) that will help kickstart my career in the Speciality Coffee Industry. I‚Äôm thankful to Jeanne and Yani for the amount of encouragement, time and effort they have put in to open doors like this for me - even preparing me for my interview with them.
.
They believed in me even when I didn‚Äôt believe in myself and because of that, I was able to take a step of faith to pursue this programme to become a barista. SPIN has played a big part in helping me reach where I am today ‚Äì full of hope and purpose in my life.
.
My hope is to find a stable job that will allow me to be financially independent so that I can afford a place of my own where I can support, provide for, and raise my two children.‚Äù - Yuni
.
Help us change the lives of more vulnerable single parents like Yuni by clicking the link in our bio!
.
All donations are eligible for 250% tax deduction.
.
.

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on January 17, 2020 tagging @ncss.sg, @msfcares, @beanstalksinglemums, and @beanstalksingapore. May be an image of text that says '"I've always felt stressed about my family's situation. But with SPIN SPIN's support,l' I'm I'm support working hard towards my goal of being free from financial difficulties. WAHIDA, SINGLE MOTHER OF 2'.
description:
‚ÄúStress used to be the only constant for me because of my family situation. I couldn't provide for my two daughters, much less bring them out.
.
But now, I can finally feel happy because of SPIN. I'm thankful for the help offered to me in terms of food rations and even outings for my children. It brings me much joy to bring my children out, especially because I could never afford to do so before.
.
I was given the opportunity to attend workshops and empowerment sessions such as leather crafting and CV writing. In fact, I've regularly attended almost all of these sessions organised by SPIN. They made me feel more empowered to provide for my children because I was learning new things that could help me better myself, find a job or earn some money.
.
My goal is to be free from financial difficulties and spend more time with my kids as they grow up. I wish for my kids good health, and hope that they develop a heart of kindness especially to those in need - just like the kindness SPIN staff and volunteers have shown to us." - Wahida
.
Help us change the lives of more vulnerable single parents like Wahida by clicking the link in our bio!
.

.
