caption: Photo shared by The Reservist on January 11, 2020 tagging @thenewpaper, @todayonline, @channelnewsasia, @sgagsg, @mothershipsg, @mindefsg, @thersaf, @straits_times, @msfcares, @ng_eng_hen, and @memedefsg. May be an image of text that says 'The Online Citizen HOME CURRENT AFFAIRS OPINION INTERNATIONAL COMMUNITY LIFESTYLE Twelve F- F-35 fighter jets at S$3.7 billion cost more than entire 2019 budget of MSF Correspondent Posted Jan, CurrentA 2MINREAD DO was ted yesterday thathe the US has approved the sale upto F-35 12F-35 fighter jetsto Singapore round USS2 75 billion S$3.7 billion US approves $2.75 bn fighter jet sale to Singapore¬Æ Jan)'.
description:
ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èThe inevitable comparison of the cost of the military budget - in this case, the cost of purchasing up to 12 F-35Bs - to the MSF budget by The Online Citizen.

ùó¢ùóª ùó¶ùóπùóÆùòÄùóµùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùóßùóµùó≤ ùóóùó≤ùó≥ùó≤ùóªùó∞ùó≤ ùóïùòÇùó±ùó¥ùó≤ùòÅ
The effectiveness of a military and its budget is NOT in how many bullets/missiles we fire at our enemies or how many battles our soldiers fight in. It is rather the OPPOSITE. The military‚Äôs true effectiveness is in the battles it DOES NOT have to fight (i.e. the lives it DOES NOT have to sacrifice to war) and the bullets/missiles it DOES NOT have to fire. If our military doesn‚Äôt have targets to shoot at, that is mission success. Because it means no enemies dare cross us, and we may enjoy a modicum of peace. It‚Äôs called Deterrence.

It‚Äôs a peace and stability that we as a people, even the folks at TOC, get to take for granted. Today, we don‚Äôt have to shoot anyone, and we should be thankful for it.

ùó¢ùóª ùó™ùóµùó≤ùòÅùóµùó≤ùóø ùó™ùó≤ ùó°ùó≤ùó≤ùó± ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùóô-ùüØùü±ùòÄ
Now, part of maintaining the security status quo is making sure that we change along with the times. Our F-16s are ageing and the F-35s are replacements for a key pillar of our military defence. They‚Äôre expensive, but absolutely necessary. 
It took more than 10 years for the RSAF and DSTA for their time and expertise to make such evaluation and we say, trust them to do their job.

ùó¢ùóª ùó¶ùóºùó∞ùó∂ùóÆùóπ ùó¶ùóΩùó≤ùóªùó±ùó∂ùóªùó¥
Before anyone tries to suggest, ‚ÄúDoes that mean that the military budget should grow indefinitely?‚Äù, we‚Äôre going to stop you here. It‚Äôs easy to start thinking that our Ministers make arbitrary decisions about the budget. 
But the ministries are staffed by Singaporeans too - they may be your parents, neighbours, relatives, or maybe even your children who've graduated university already. Trust them to do their job right and calibrate our budget right. After all, we‚Äôre not only paying the ministers to do so, we‚Äôre paying the entire civil sector too.

ùóßùóü;ùóóùó•
Our military spending keeps us safe and allows us to go about our way of life. Don‚Äôt cut it anyhow. Trust people to do their jobs right.

ùóßùóº ùóßùó¢ùóñ: It‚Äôs election season, but let‚Äôs not politicise Singapore‚Äôs security lah.

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on January 10, 2020 tagging @comchestsg, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, and @singaporecares. May be an image of text that says 'After my wife' 's death, had to learn how to be both father fath and mother at the same time. SPIN supported me as readjusted to being the sole caregiver sole RONALD, SINGLE FATHER OF 2'.
description:
‚ÄúAfter my wife‚Äôs fatal accident, I was left as a widower and single father to two young sons. I have been their sole caregiver since.
.
Growing up, my own mother left the family and my father remarried. So I struggled with the fact that my children may grow up in a "similar" situation as me.
.
I had to readjust my life after my wife‚Äôs death such as rearranging my regular priorities to deal with practical concerns. I now have a helper to assist with my children and divide the chores such as cooking, cleaning and getting groceries.
.
One thing that could have prepared me for fatherhood is knowing how to handle kids like how mothers can. As a single father, it is a struggle to know how to be a father and mother at the same time.
.
I still remember how my older son, then four years old, asked why his mother wasn‚Äôt with us on Mothers' Day. The loss still feels apparent especially when I think about how my wife will no longer be able to watch our sons get married.
.
HCSA Dayspring SPIN reached out to me when my wife‚Äôs accident came out in the news. SPIN offered me social support by matching me with a volunteer befriender. This was helpful because being a widower is often not talked about in Singapore ‚Äì it‚Äôs a topic people find hard to broach.
.
SPIN supported me in my parenting journey, even though it‚Äôs still something I struggle with at times especially when it comes to the kind of gentleness needed in handling my sons.‚Äù - Ronald
.
Help us change the lives of more single parents like Ronald by making a donation here: www.giving.sg/hcsa/EmpowerSingleParents
.
All donations are eligible for 250% tax deduction.
.
.
(Photo by Grace Yeoh from Rice Media)
.
.
.

May be an image of text that says '·Äï·Äî·Ä∏ "It's hard to go out and work with 5 children 2 with special needs. ds. But like being a mom and I'll try my best, with SPIN's support. KARTIGAH, SINGLE MOTHER OF 5'.
description:
"My focus has always been raising my kids - a set of triplets and two older kids. But with no support from their father, it was very difficult!
.
Having two young kids with special needs, I had to quit my job as a food stall helper to stay home and take care of the one who was unable to get into student care. Managing a big family like mine made it hard to find time to do anything else, much less go out to work.
.
My work options are limited especially due to the lack of caregiving support I receive for my triplets, so I have been sourcing for home-based work that is tailored to my sewing skills. SPIN linked me up with a social enterprise called E&S Blessing‚Äã that guided me in starting a small home-based business to supplement my family's income. I was the first on board their Celebrating Dreams mentoring initiative that aims to support single mothers, like myself, by providing us a platform to tap on our skills.
.
As going out to find a job is a big difficulty for me, opportunities like this have been so helpful because they enable me to earn some money while being assured that my children are well taken care off. I'm hoping to improve my sewing skills and will definitely go for classes if they're available!
.
With SPIN‚Äôs assistance and support, I have been empowered to make small changes to improve my situation. It is not easy, but I will try my best because I like being a mom. On one part, it‚Äôs okay and fun. On the other, it is also very stressful. But when my children are happy and I see them happy, that‚Äôs when I‚Äôm happy ‚Äì and that is what makes everything okay.‚Äù
.

.

May be an image of text that says 'Mama "I was unprepared for my baby' S arrival and and struggled to orovide for her But SPIN has helped and journeyed with me from pregnancy till today." LAYLA, SINGLE MOTHER OF 1'.
description:
‚ÄúWhen I found out I was pregnant, I was afraid to have my baby because of the abuse I was facing by my own mother at home. At that time, I had nobody to talk to about this, neither did I have any newborn items to prepare for my baby's arrival.
.
I was referred to SPIN when I was 4 months pregnant and they journeyed with me until my delivery. I was blessed with baby clothes, maternity clothes, and other items that I didn't even know I would need.
.
They continued to support me even after I gave birth. When a SPIN volunteer found out I had no cupboard to store my baby's clothes, she pooled her resources to get me brand-new plastic drawers to keep the clothes neatly. It was also through SPIN that I learned how to raise my newborn daughter with the help of a child nurse volunteer and lactation consultant. Without them, I would still be unable to feed my daughter because of her lip and tongue ties.
.
In my time with SPIN, I've attended several empowerment sessions that allowed me to open up and learn from fellow mothers who have gone through similar situations as me. These sessions have taught me practical skills such as solids-making tips, and have also inspired me to make steps towards pursuing my dreams through activities such as vision-boarding. I'm grateful to the volunteers who help watch our children so that we, parents, can make the most of these inspiring workshops.
.
My daughter is now my priority. Even if I have to forgo my income for days, I will keep her at home when she is sick so she can rest properly. I want to create a hygienic, safe and conducive home environment for her, make sure she has clean clothes to wear, clean bedsheets to sleep on, and clean toys to play with. I am also learning to cook nutritious meals for her." - Layla
.

May be an image of text that says '"With the the fresh food that SPIN provided, could finally prepare home cooked meals for my girls. Doing so brought me so much joy!" NAYLI, SINGLE MOTHER OF 2'.
description:
"Growing up, I never had a motherly figure to look up to as my parents divorced when I was very young and my mom was absent for most of my childhood. So, I never really knew what a mother should be like.
.
At first, I was having post-natal blues and it was difficult to deal with my emotions especially being alone with two "new-born" kids. I never understood what true support felt like and I didn't quite trust the SPIN counsellors and volunteers at the start. But I was so wrong.
.
SPIN provided me with a strong support system through my volunteers, Jyostna and Kirsty, who have been extremely supportive of me and regularly check to see how I'm doing. They were the ones who made strive to be a better person and a good mom to my kids.
.
With SPIN‚Äôs fresh food programme, I was able to prepare home-cooked meals for my daughters which brought me a lot of joy. I also actively attend SPIN‚Äôs events and workshops as they provide a good platform for me to meet other moms like myself, learn more about being a good mother and also let my daughters enjoy activities I would otherwise not be able to bring them for.
.
Now that I am a mother myself, I am trying my best to be independent and self-reliant, working hard to upgrade myself. I'm thankful for the close relationship I have with both my daughters and I always tell them to never give up. Both of them mean a lot to me and I hope to be a responsible mother who shows them great care and affection." - Nayli
.

.

May be an image of text that says 'HCSA COMMUNITY SERVICES "THERE IS NO HURRY. WE SHALL GET THERE ONE DAY"'.
description:
In a fast-paced society, rushing has become the new normal. You may even be rushing right now!
.
Unfortunately, not everything can be rushed and recovery is one of them - especially for the vulnerable populations that we serve.
.
It takes time to recover from the trauma of abuse, addictions, mental health conditions, or broken relationships, but we believe that our beneficiaries will get there one day!
.
.
.
.
#MotivationMonday #inspirationalquotes #motivationalquotes #quoteoftheday #dogood #socialgood #cityofgood #empoweringthevulnerable #socialservice #communityservice #changemakers #makeadifference #sgcares #msfcares #comchestsg

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on December 13, 2019 tagging @awaresingapore, @comchestsg, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, @babes_pregnancysupport, @daughtersoftomorrow, @singaporecares, @beanstalksingapore, and @givingweeksg. May be an image of text that says '"Left jobless, penniless and homeless, trie taking ng my own life. But things took a turn for the better when was introduced to SPIN.' EVA, SINGLE MOTHER OF'.
description:
"Every couple wishes to have a happy and perfect life after the wedding, but in my case, I waited for a 'happily ever after' that never existed. I had a toxic relationship with my husband and I never knew what it felt like to be loved for who I am.
.
We separated after he introduced me to illegal substances and had an affair. Even after, he would demand sexual favours in exchange for monthly maintenance of our four children.
.
In the darkest moment of my life - unemployed, penniless and homeless - I spent nights in public areas and tried taking my own life with sleeping pills and a razor. I was incarcerated for possession and consumption of illegal substances. But things took a turn for the better upon my release when I was introduced to SPIN.
.
For the first time in my life, I felt genuine happiness. With SPIN's empathy and support, I learned how to be brave at my lowest points and even found a job to support my family.
.
I started to appreciate the beauty around me and would like to encourage others to do the same: each failure is not an obstacle but a stepping stone, each piece of advice is not an insult but a guide to better yourself." - Eva
.

On 11 December 2019, the 2nd Milk and Diaper distribution run was delivered to several agencies, including Babes, Care Corner FSCs, Kreta Ayer FSC, etc to deliver diapers and formula milk to low-income families with infants and young children. Each child will receive up to 2 tins of formula milk and 4 packs of diapers, which will help sustain the family for up to a month. Our team was ecstatic to bring cheer to needy children this holiday season. 
You can do your part to help by supporting our future milk and diaper distribution runs > https://www.giving.sg/campaigns/milk_and_diaper_run2019

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on December 12, 2019 tagging @comchestsg, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, and @singaporecares.
description:
‚ÄúLooking at other ‚Äònice‚Äô families always filled me with so much jealousy and sadness because mine was nothing like that. I wasn‚Äôt on good terms with my mom and I was always upset with my own family, so I started staying out most of the time.
.
Self-harm and alcohol became my way of coping with my emotions. Not long after, I attempted suicide and became unsafe to myself. This was when I was sent to Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre.
.
The place became a strong pillar of support in my recovery. It was there where I learned more about myself and started to feel better about my life. Instead of harming and intoxicating myself, I found healthier ways to cope with my stress and sadness. Slowly, I traded away my negative and harmful thoughts, and filled myself with positive ones instead. This helped me concentrate in my studies."
.
Kassie is an alumni of HCSA Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre - a Therapeutic Group Home for teenage girls who have suffered the complex trauma of abuse.
.
.
.
.

description:
All parents want to 'do better', but some just don't know how to start. By supporting vulnerable single parents in these areas, we hope to empower them into the 'better' parents they desire to be.
.
Basic household items like a rice cooker or electric kettle can allow our beneficiaries to cook a simple meal for their family or prepare milk for their little ones. Those with school-going children will also be able to better support their children's education with the school supplies and stationery they need.
.
Most importantly, we hope to empower our beneficiaries into independent individuals who can support themselves and their family by helping them upgrade their skills, improve themselves and achieve their dreams.
.
Donate at giving.sg/hcsa/EmpowerSingleParents [LINK IN BIO] .
.
.
.
.

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on November 28, 2019 tagging @comchestsg, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, @singaporecares, @socialservicesgconnect, and @givingweeksg. May be an image of text that says 'FRESH FOOD GROCERIES & NEWBORN ESSENTIALS'.
description:
These items may seem like a given, but there are single parents who struggle to afford them.
.
With no stable income, some of the single moms we serve are unable to purchase essentials like diapers and milk powder for their newborn child. For other parents, their inability to afford fresh groceries prevents them from preparing nutritious home-cooked meals for their children and they often resort to less-healthy and convenient alternatives.
.
We hope to empower our beneficiaries into independent individuals who can support themselves and their family, but we recognise that helping them meet their basic needs is the first step to do so.
.
Donate at giving.sg/hcsa/EmpowerSingleParents [LINK IN BIO] .
.
.
.
.

description:
Raising kids is no easy feat but imagine the overwhelming feeling of struggling to support your family alone. That's how it feels like for the single parents we serve.
.
We seek your support in helping us empower these vulnerable single parents with the resources and skills they need to become responsible caregivers for the children they love.
.
Our hope is to improve their quality of life and eventually support them to become independent individuals who can provide for themselves and their family.
.
Your donation can help single parents families with their basic necessities and give them a better future.
.

Supporting our seniors like Mr Tan:

Some of you may have seen a recent post where someone snapped photos of an elderly man sleeping at Bukit Merah View Hawker Centre. We want to share with you the story of Mr Tan, and the many helping hands in Henderson Dawson who have been helping him since 2004. 
Mr Tan was found sleeping below the CTE by a good samaritan in 2004, and was referred to our Bukit Merah View Thong Kheng Seniors Activity Centre programme coordinator Mr Anthony Teo for help. Since then, HDB has provided a rental unit to Mr Tan at Henderson Heights, and he is also receiving financial assistance as well as free meals provided by Thong Kheng. 
Mr Tan does not have relatives here, and it‚Äôs Mr Anthony Teo who has been helping Mr Tan with all necessary procedures and visiting him whenever Mr Tan had to be admitted to the hospital. 
Mr Tan is not homeless as the post alleged. There are nights when Mr Tan chooses to sleep at the market when it‚Äôs cooler and quieter, but he does have a home to go back to. We local VWOs and community partners will of course continue to ensure that Mr Tan gets the help that he needs, as we love and respect our elderly in Henderson Dawson a lot. 
DM us if you would like to #volunteer. Together #WeLLCareInHenderson

description:
So much has changed since we first met Jaslyn: ‚ÄúMy children and I can now share so much smiles and laughter thanks to SPIN. They helped me establish and stabilise a routine of work and care-giving so that I could support my family to the best of my ability.
.
Since then, my social worker has always been there to listen to my problems and advise me when I have no one to turn to.
.
Through SPIN's outings and empowerment workshops, I started to widen my social support circle by meeting with volunteers and other single parents like myself. My children were able to experience things I could never have afforded.
.
The counseling sessions also helped me become a better parent who can manage my finances and plan for my future. I am very appreciative of  how SPIN has shaped me into the person I am today."
.
With your support, SPIN can continue changing the lives of single parent families like Jaslyn's. Watch this page to find out how you can do your part!
.
.
.
.

#OSWA is the highest award to social workers conferred by the President of the Republic of Singapore and aims to recognise the outstanding contributions made by dedicated #socialworkers.

"I am grateful to Dr Chong, our medical director and Angie, our CEO for nominating me for the award and SASW for giving me the award. "It has been a humbling experience ever since I signed up as an ally volunteer with SPIN because I started to better understand the challenges that single parents face and the sacrifices they make to take care of their children. Moments like these make my volunteering experience very enjoyable."
.
Kerry is a volunteer at HCSA Dayspring SPIN, a programme which empowers single parents by providing them with emotional, physical and practical support. .

Early childhood educators are professionals with passion and purpose. They play a crucial role in nurturing our children in their formative years. 
On Wednesday, over 400 future and current early childhood educators received the ECDA Scholarships and Training Awards that will support them in their career aspirations in the sector. We will support these educators at every stage of their journey to deepen their professional knowledge and ensure a fulfilling career. Many educators I met told me how their families, friends and colleagues are sources of inspiration and motivation for them to become the best teachers they can be. 
All of us play a part in giving every child a good start. Let us continue to empower our early childhood educators and help them succeed!

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on October 11, 2019 tagging @awaresingapore, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, @daughtersoftomorrow, @singaporecares, and @beanstalksingapore.
description:
Only a student, imagine the thoughts that ran through Michelle's* mind when she first found out she was going to become a mom.
.
"I felt so alone and afraid because I didn't know what to do, where to go to, or who to look to for support. I knew being a single mom would not be easy and I was fearful because society still finds it hard to accept single parents like us.
.
But joining SPIN helped me to realise that I am not as alone as I once thought I was. In fact, the volunteers and social workers showed me that I was never alone in this journey by offering to help me wholeheartedly should I ever needed help.
.
SPIN even went to the extent of helping me with diapers, milk powder and other necessities for my child, which I am more than grateful for!
.
Being a part of SPIN was a huge comfort for me because I now had a platform to turn to and a community of single parents like myself. It was great getting to interact with other mums because we could relate to each other, share our experiences and encourage one another.
.
I have to admit that it's still not easy to be a single mom, but at least I don't feel alone and I know that SPIN will be there to support me into becoming a good mom."
.
.
.
.
#successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #sgcares #family #humansofsingapore #singlemother #singleparenting #singlemom #socialservice #msfcares #humansofsingapore #changemaker #makeadifference

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on October 05, 2019 tagging @comchestsg, @giveasia, @ncss.sg, and @msfcares.
description:
It wasn't easy for Teena* to break her cycle of self-harm, but here's how she did it.
.
‚ÄúI battled with issues such as smoking, drinking and cutting for many years. They were big hurdles that prevented me from getting better, hurdles that I couldn‚Äôt overcome.
.
Cutting, especially, was the biggest habit I couldn‚Äôt stop. I would cut myself when I was angry and depressed. I felt worthless and helpless, like I was never good enough - and the cycle of cutting repeated. As a result, I was admitted to the Institute of Mental Health several times.
.
Soon after, my caseworker decided that it would be best for me to come to Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre. Dayspring helped me to boost my self-esteem by teaching me proper values and skills to manage my emotions. I started to accept myself more.
.
I am a very different person today as compared to the day I first stepped into Dayspring. Now, I no longer harm myself and my family relationships have been very good.
.
My passion is to help people and I hope that my experience at Dayspring and my story can motivate and inspire others that are going through a similar situation as me.‚Äù
.
.
.
.
#successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #girlssupportgirls #girlssupportinggirls #empowerment #abusesurvivor #sgcares #abusedwomen #family #humansofsingapore #msfcares #selfharm

description:
Can you imagine what it would feel like to be unimportant to your own family? Penny* knew that feeling all too well. Here's her story.
.
‚ÄúI always doubted whether I was important to my family because I was either beaten, abused or chase out of my house. No one ever fought for me, only with me.
.
Having two dads, I never knew who my biological father was. But it didn‚Äôt matter because I was abused by him anyway ‚Äì beaten, scolded and forced into doing chores. Even my mum couldn‚Äôt help me because my dad would beat her too.
.
There were even times when my mum was the one who chased me out when we argued or when she was drunk. Running away from home became the new normal. My mum had to file a missing person report multiple times.
.
Even when my family problems subsided, I would still runaway because my friends showed me more love than my family ever did. I felt more comfortable being out than at home. But my friends landed me on the wrong path of smoking, drinking and other bad things.
.
Even though I tried to change for the better, my past still affected me and my family problems still persisted ‚Äì so I just went back to how I used to be. Soon, I was sent to Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre because I stopped attending school and constantly ran away from home.
.
Being at Dayspring has helped me learn how to cope with my family problems. The staff also guided me through my trust issues and helped to build my self-esteem. I hope that my family will be able to live happily with each other and not fight as much anymore ‚Äì neither do I want to be chased away by my mum again.‚Äù
.
.
.
.
#successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #girlssupportgirls #girlssupportinggirls #empowerment #abusesurvivor #sgcares #abusedwomen #family #humansofsingapore #msfcares

description:
She was only a student when she became a mother, but Gemma* now hopes to become the best mum she can be - all thanks to SPIN. Here's her story.
.
"I‚Äôve become more positive and motivated about life ever since I joined SPIN. I‚Äôm thankful to Linda, my ally volunteer, for all the support she has given to my son and I. Not only was she there for me at the lowest point of my life, she also helped me get back on my feet again.
.
At SPIN, I always felt well taken care of. My social worker always looked out for me and never failed to update me about any upcoming events - even till today. And for that, I'm very grateful.
.
For now, I‚Äôm striving hard to be a good mum who raises my son well - the first step would be to find a proper job. My hope for my son is that he will never feel inferior just because he comes from a single parent family because even children from such families can grow up well too."
.
.
.
.
#successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #empowermen #sgcares #family #humansofsingapore #singlemother #singleparenting #socialservice #msfcares #humansofsingapore #successstory

description:
Growing up, Elaine* constantly felt alone - till she found a special group of people to journey along with her instead.
.
"I never had much support or supervision at home since young. Because of this, I was often depressed - I felt unloved and unwanted most of the time. This was until I came to Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre.
.
I was taught proper coping methods of how to regulate my emotions and soon started to develop a healthy view of myself. I also became more aware of my actions, and how they might affect others in return.
.
Knowing that there were people who cared enough about me and wanted to journey alongside with me was the biggest encouragement. Their support encouraged me to attain a vocational training institution to fulfill my dream of becoming a professional make-up artist one day."
.
.
.
.
.

description:
It's a MYTH that self-care is confined to a one-time activity. Taking care of yourself won't come naturally - it requires an ongoing and intentional effort but it's definitely worth it! #MythOrFact
.
.
.
.
#mythorfact #mythbusters #mythvsfacts #empowerment #singleparents #soloparenting #singlemother #singlefather #socialsupport #socialservice #hcsaspin #empowerment #empoweringwomen #empoweringmen #msfcares #sgcares #selflove #selfcare #loveyourself

Family is a central part of our lives. Our families bring us joy and meaning, comfort and companionship. 
Helping more young people see that raising a family is Achievable, Enjoyable and Celebrated ‚Äì this is what we, as a society, can collectively do to make Singapore a Great Place for Families. 
Yesterday, @desmond.lee, @dramykhor, and I visited one of My First Skool‚Äôs newest preschools @Punggol. Always a joy to be among kids. 
We shared more details on some of the areas that PM @leehsienloong had spoken about at #NDR2019. Healthcare, preschool, and housing are concerns that shape the decisions of many young Singaporeans, who are considering marriage, and starting their family. We will further support Singaporeans in three key areas: 
1)Making quality preschool more affordable and accessible for families

2)Extending support to first-time home buyers. @lawrencewongst will share more next month.

3)Providing more healthcare support for couples and children 
More details on the enhancements can be found at https://www.heybaby.sg. 
Many Singaporeans want to have meaningful family lives, while establishing fulfilling careers. Workplace cultures and norms need to become more supportive of family life. But this is a cultural issue that Government policies alone cannot address. To improve work-life harmony in Singapore, we need to tackle the issues together. Next month, the Citizens‚Äô Panel on Work-Life Harmony will look into ways to create more family-friendly workplaces. 
I hope parents take the enhancements in Government support in the right spirit. In some countries, the parents pocket the savings and re-direct their efforts to spending quality time with their children. Lighten your burden, and make raising children more enjoyable. 
Let us all help one another to keep parenting enjoyable. It‚Äôs not a race against one another, but a journey of joy and love we can all take together. 
#Singapore #ndrsg #family #instagram

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on August 23, 2019 tagging @cnb.drugfreesg, @yellowribbonsg, @giveasia, @ncss.sg, and @msfcares.
description:
Wanting more to life than just 'me & drugs', Jamal promised to never touch another drug again - and so he has stayed for the last 4 years! Here's his story.
.
‚ÄúI spent half my age in and out of prison for drug-related offences. It was after NS that I had my first taste of drugs out of curiosity, but things started to collapse when I got introduced to heroin. I kept thinking to myself: I can quit any time. Little did I know that I would only keep tumbling.
.
During my incarceration, I constantly gave false hope to my family ‚Äì each time claiming that it would be ‚Äúthe last‚Äù. I even wrote them letters. But despite all of this, I would always fall back down again. It was only after my last release that I made a resolution to myself and my family that this was truly the last time.
.
Even though I was the black sheep of my family, my mother and brother would always come to visit me. But there was a time when my mum didn‚Äôt visit for 3 months. Puzzled, I later found that she was ill and bedridden. This made me very anxious about my release so I could visit her. Thankfully, I managed to see her upon my release and spend the last 3 years of her life by her side.
.
Being a reserved individual, I always kept to myself and didn‚Äôt really like to mix around a lot. After coming to Highpoint, I started to open up my mind to what‚Äôs good for me ‚Äì which is socialising with people. Now, I look forward to exposing myself to new people and experiences. I want to see more to my life than just ‚Äòme‚Äô and ‚Äòdrugs‚Äô. After all, a colourful life doesn‚Äôt need to come from drugs. There are so many other ways to feel that ‚Äòhigh‚Äô, you can dance, play soccer, but drugs is not the thing.
.
I‚Äôve been sober for the past 4 years. Until now, I haven‚Äôt had the slightest chance to see what drugs look like ‚Äì and I don‚Äôt intend to either. It is unfortunate that my mum can‚Äôt see where I am now, but I am sure she will be proud of me from where she is.‚Äù
.
.
.
.
.
.
#testimony #successstory #lifestory #exoffender #drugaddicts #empowerment #empoweringmen #sgcares #msfcares #humansofsingapore #turnoveranewleaf #DrugFreeSG @cnb.drugfreesg

description:
Valerie strongly believes that children from single parent families are no less than their peers! Her relationship with her 5-year-old son tells it all - here's her story.
.
"As a single mother, there are still times that I experience loneliness in my parenting journey and get little respite from the daily care-giving of Jovan. Despite having a small group of close friends I seek emotional support from, there are many practical areas in which they are unable to help me with.
.
But at the end of the day, what I appreciate the most is watching Jovan grow up like any other kid in an ‚Äòintact‚Äô family.
.
I am happy to see that he‚Äôs not losing out, and in certain cases I think he is very blessed because my love for him is more than sufficient.
.
I cherish the moments when Jovan kisses and hugs me, and tells me that he loves me the most in the world - ‚ÄúI love you the most mama and I know you take care of me whenever I‚Äôm sick‚Äù. These are things he says that may not mean that much to him, but I would do it all over again just for him.‚Äù
.
.
.
.
.
#successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #empowermen #sgcares #family #humansofsingapore #singlemother #singleparenting #socialservice #msfcares #humansofsingapore #successstory

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on August 02, 2019 tagging @humansofsingapore, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, and @singaporecares.
description:
Trapped in a cycle of addiction, self-harm and suicidal thoughts, Natalie* finally found herself a safe place. Here's her story.
.
‚ÄúNever once did I expect to be abused by my own family. I was sexually abused by my grandfather and three cousins, while my aunties often verbally abused me by calling me names. The name-calling continued in school where I was bullied for my size and skin-colour.
.
I needed a way to numb the pain so I began cutting myself ‚Äì first out of curiosity, and then as an addiction. Cutting became my drug, to the point where I would cut myself every day after school. It was a form of self-punishment for anything that happened in life, even if it was something small.
.
Honestly, I didn‚Äôt see a reason to continue living and attempted my first suicide in 2014. This landed me in a children‚Äôs home where I attempted suicide again. This time, I took enough drugs to feel the pain, but not enough to die.
.
I was sent to a safer place ‚Äì HCSA Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre. DRTC helped me to cope with my past and my depression. I mean, no one can cure my illness, but there are people who can help me to help myself. And that was what DRTC did for me.
.
They helped me find my voice, when I thought I had lost it forever; they started me on the journey towards freedom.‚Äù
.
.
.
.
.
#successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #girlssupportgirls #girlssupportinggirls #empowerment #abusesurvivor #sgcares #abusedwomen #family #humansofsingapore #msfcares

description:
#IVolunteerBecause I want to empower single parents to prepare home-cooked meals for their families.
.
"Home should be a refuge for the family. And it makes me happy if I can, in any way, impart skills and share knowledge to help parents make the home a place where the whole family feels a sense of belonging to. Very often, the kitchen and dining room is the centre of activity where families can bond ‚Äì and this is where I hope to make an impact.
.
To do so, I conduct cooking sessions with the SPIN members as part of Fresh Food Project where I empower them to create delicious and wholesome meals for their families. The experience of sharing food and life together with the single parents has been truly rewarding - helping me empathise and understand their struggles better in the process."
.
This is Celina - she volunteers her time and culinary expertise at HCSA Dayspring SPIN, a programme that empowers single parents facing limited support. .
.
.

description:
Isha* always thought that being a single mother meant parenting alone. But she soon learned that it didn't have to be that way.
.
"Before I joined SPIN, my life was all sorts of stress. I found it extremely difficult to cope with my son - especially as a single mum. But SPIN showed me that I wasn't alone, by giving single mothers like myself a platform to share about our struggles and learn how to cope with them.
.
I'm thankful for the many outings that my son and I could participate in, and for all the advice that the SPIN family has given me. Not only did they help me feel less alone, they have also motivated me to strive hard to provide for my family. My hope is for my son to be a good boy and learn how to be independent.
.
SPIN has really changed our lives for the better, and I am deeply appreciative of everything they have done!"
.
.
.
.
.
.
#successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #empowermen #sgcares #family #humansofsingapore #singlemother #singleparenting #socialservice #msfcares #humansofsingapore #successstory

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on July 05, 2019 tagging @ncss.sg, @msfcares, and @singaporecares.
description:
From abandoned to accepted, here's the story of how Anastasia* found the sense of belonging she desired for since young.
.
"My parents were never around when I was young and I grew up often feeling abandoned, never having experienced family warmth and love. I was placed in foster care and I often struggled with managing my feelings and emotions.
.
To me, Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre (DRTC) was a safe environment for me to discover my strengths and learned skills on how to regulate my feelings. I learned that there are people who care a lot about me, and I started reciprocating the love to others as well. As I did so, I began to find a sense of belonging.
.
I have now moved into a new foster family who have been very welcoming to me. They have showered me with the warmth and love that I previously lacked but always longed for."
.
.
.
.
.
#successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #girlssupportgirls #girlssupportinggirls #empowerment #abusesurvivor #sgcares #abusedwomen #family #humansofsingapore #msfcares

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on June 21, 2019 tagging @ncss.sg, and @msfcares.
description:
Anger and mistrust were all Cindy* ever knew since young. Here's the story of how her life changed.
.
"At a very young age, I was placed in foster care and spent my early childhood years enduring traumatic experiences. Because of these experiences, I grew up filled with anger and I constantly felt like I could never trust anyone in my life. Whenever I was upset, I would lash out and hit the people who tried to show me care.
.
But things changed when I came to HCSA Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre (DRTC). I started to feel safe and accepted by staff who persistently showed me care and support. They helped me recognise how my past had such a big impact on how I reacted to people in different situations.
.
Now, I am learning to regulate my emotions and discover more about myself. As I do so, it has helped me to build deeper relationships and live peacefully with others around me. My hope is move back home and be with my family some day."
.
.
.
.
.
.
#successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #girlssupportgirls #girlssupportinggirls #empowerment #abusesurvivor #sgcares #abusedwomen #family #humansofsingapore #msfcares

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on June 20, 2019 tagging @ncss.sg, @msfcares, @mybabychakra, and @singaporecares.
description:
Can a total stranger help you in raising your child? Here's what a volunteer with our single parents at HCSA Dayspring SPIN thinks!‚ò∫Ô∏è
.
"In my five years of managing and building a parenting community online, I have witnessed this not a just a few but many times. Yes, the community of friends and even strangers who have common goals can help and at times better than relatives.
.
My online parenting community online, BabyChakra‚Äã, sees this happen every single day. Mothers and Fathers login to the App and discuss their parenting issues. Some have even become very good friends.
.
It may not be as easy when meeting face to face. You may wonder ‚ÄúWhat do I talk about?‚Äù or ‚ÄúHow and why will a stranger help?‚Äù These are common hesitations. But just stop and think. The people in the community, SPIN, have many things in common. They understand your concerns and challenges as a single parent. They are more likely to show empathy and care for you. They may just have some advice that can help you.
.
Even if you are not looking for advice, being a part of a meaningful group of friends who help each other is a great feeling in itself. The sense of belonging fills you up with an unbeatable courage and confidence.
.
Take it slow if you like. Your comfort is most important. You may start off with a casual meeting and just introduce yourself. Share with the group what you like to do. Take small steps to participate and interact with other single parents at SPIN. All it takes is a few small steps to being a confident person and parent. SPIN is here for you."
.
Be a part of the online parenting community here: wwww.BabyChakra.com
.
.
.
.
#babychakra #empowerment #empoweringwomen #singlemother #parenting #pregnancy #singleparenting #singleparents #parentingcommunity #sgparents #empoweringparents

description:

.
‚ÄúOne thing I wish I knew about fatherhood was knowing how to handle kids the way mothers can. As a single father, it was a struggle - I had to learn how to be a father and a mother both at the same time. But I tell myself to just keep going and to trust God, because nothing else matters more than this."

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on June 07, 2019 tagging @humansofsingapore, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, @beanstalksinglemums, and @beanstalksingapore.
description:
Saying bye to a life of constant stress, Wati found new hope to support her family. Here's her story.
.
"For a long time, stress was the only thing I felt about my family situation. But now, I can finally feel happy! I am thankful for what SPIN has done for me and I feel at home with the friendly volunteers and staff. They have offered me so much help - food rations and even outings for my children. It brings me much joy just being able to bring the kids out!
.
I also feel empowered to provide for my kids after attending workshops such as crafting and CV writing. My goal is to be free from financial difficulties and spend more time with my children. My greatest wish is for my children to have good health and develop a heart of kindness."
.
.
.
.
.
#successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #empowermen #sgcares #family #humansofsingapore #singlemother #singleparenting #socialservice #msfcares #humansofsingapore #singlemum #msfcares

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on May 02, 2019 tagging @ncss.sg, @msfcares, and @singaporecares.
description:
While many seek comfort from their families, Isabella* felt even more unsafe with hers. Here's her story.
.
"There was always violence at home and I used to feel afraid very often. As a result, I had a lot of anger issues and was removed from my family to be placed in a Voluntary Children‚Äôs Home.
.
When I first came to Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre (DRTC), I was untrusting of adults and felt like running away. But eventually during my stay, I started to make a lot of new friends and slowly adopted new ways of regulating and coping with my emotions in a healthier way.
.
As I worked through my past trauma and abuse, the staff worked with my family to create opportunities for rebuilding and restoring family relationships. I look forward to moving back home with them one day."
.
.
.
.
#testimonialthursday #successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #girlssupportgirls #empowerment #abusesurvivor #sgcares #abusedwomen #family #humansofsingapore #sgcares #msfcares

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on April 18, 2019 tagging @ncss.sg, @msfcares, @singaporecares, and @socialservicesgconnect.
description:
With 4 children from 3 different fathers, Jaclyn never thought she could ever provide for them...until now. Here's her story.
.
"All my divorces had a recurring pattern - they were always about criminal and drug related issues. In fact, I used to be a drug addict and an offender myself. With my past and my bankruptcy status, it was almost impossible to find a job.I desperately needed one as I had no family support.
.
Since I joined SPIN, my children and I have experienced so much smiles and laughter. I could never afford to fulfill my children‚Äôs dreams, but SPIN changed that for me! They provided us with food rations, furniture and toys, and even organised many fun outings. More importantly, SPIN supported me in gaining financial independence by arranging a job interview with a partner corporate organisation. They helped me establish a stable routine of work and care-giving to best support my family.
.
Through events and SPIN empowerment sessions, I started to widen my social support circle by meeting with volunteers and other SPIN members like myself. I am very appreciative of the help and joy that SPIN gave me in becoming a responsible mother who has clear goals and stable employment. Because of that, I have now decided to become an ally volunteer to help other members in need."
.
.
.
.
.
#testimonialthursday #successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #empowermen #sgcares #family #humansofsingapore #singlemother #singleparenting #socialservice

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on April 11, 2019 tagging @humansofsingapore, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, and @singaporecares.
description:
The one thing that Veronica* ever really wanted is what most of us often take for granted. Here's the story of how she found a place to call home.
.
"Being the only child in my family with no close relatives, I had never experienced what family warmth and love felt like. I was even labelled as an aggressive child in my previous placements when all I ever really wanted was to have a family.
.
I was referred to HCSA Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre (DRTC) in 2017 after undergoing several placements. During my stay in DRTC, I tried very hard to fit in and to be accepted. I couldn‚Äôt regulate my emotions and often had difficulties in managing my feelings. It took me a while, but I was soon able to build rapport with the other girls and staff. I realised I didn‚Äôt need to ‚Äòtry to fit in‚Äô, I just needed to see myself as who I was.
.
In the safe environment of DRTC, I learned how to rationalise my feelings, discovered my strengths and found a sense of belonging. I learned that people cared a lot for me and started to reciprocate this love to others. I was introduced to a befriending family during my stay and treatment. They gave me a sense of security and permanence. There, I finally has a place to call home.
.
Graduating from DRTC was truly a dream come true for me as I finally had a family to go home to. I am now in my final year of school and I feel very much motivated as I finally see hope for my future."
.
.
.
.
#testimonialthursday #successstory #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #girlssupportgirls #empowerment #abusesurvivor #sgcares #abusedwomen #abusedgirl #family #humansofsingapore

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on April 01, 2019 tagging @humansofsingapore, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, and @singaporecares. May be an image of text that says '"I WAS LEFT JOBLESS PENNILESS & HOMELESS WITH FOUR CHILDREN''.
description:
The struggles faced by vulnerable women are no #AprilFools joke. Eva, a single mother of four, shares her story.
.
"After ending a toxic relationship with my ex-husband who introduced me to drugs and demanded sexual favours, I was left jobless, penniless and homeless with four children. I waited for a ‚Äòhappily ever after‚Äô that never came.
.
At this darkest moment of my life - unemployed, penniless and homeless - I spent nights in public areas and tried taking my own life with sleeping pills and a razor. But HCSA Dayspring SPIN rescued me.
.
For once in my life, I felt genuine happiness. With their empathy and support, I learned to how to be brave even at my lowest points. I started to appreciate the beauty around me and would like to encourage others to do the same."
.
.
.
.
.
#dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #empowerment #parenting #motherhood #truestory #charity #socialservice #communityservice #singlemother #nonprofit #ncss

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on March 28, 2019 tagging @humansofsingapore, @awaresingapore, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, @singaporecares, and @socialservicesgconnect.
description:
Struggling with self-harm for many years, it took one final cut for Lily* to realise that enough was enough. Here's her story.
.
"My family moved to Singapore when I was 9 years old. My father changed jobs multiple times and starting beating my mother out of stress. They fought a lot and my mother returned to China, leaving me with my father and uncle to finish my studies.
.
The uncle sexually abused me, gave me drinks and cigarettes, and kept offering me money to get what he wanted. Even when I was in pain, my uncle didn‚Äôt care. Whenever he got angry, my father scolded me for not doing anything for him ‚Äì the fact was, I did, but couldn‚Äôt tell the truth. I started self-harming, and attempted suicide.
.
I was brought to the police station after a teacher at school called my child protection officer after noticing that I was going through a crisis. My father and uncle kept calling but I was too afraid to pick up the phone. Eventually, I was warded in the hospital and sent to Dayspring for treatment.
.
I struggled for a long time trying to overcome my past. I kept blaming myself. I cut myself many times, once even on the neck in front of the other Dayspring girls. But after that cut, I realised that it simply was not worth it to keep hurting myself because it did not solve any problems. So, I stopped self-harming.
.
Now, I tell myself and others: ‚ÄòThe past is past. Now is the present. Make sure you live in the present fully and positively.‚Äô I hope that those who have gone through abuse like me can be stronger and not give up ‚Äì even though it is difficult most of the time."
.
.
.
#testimonythursday #dayspring #testimony #empoweringwomen #girlssupportgirls #empowerment #abusesurvivor #successstory #sgcares #abusedwomen #humansofsingapore #mentalhealthawareness #family

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on February 28, 2019 tagging @humansofsingapore, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, @letstalkaboutmentalhealth, and @singaporecares.
description:
Clara* grew up thinking that it was "normal" to be abused by her own father. But on her 16th birthday, everything changed. Here's her story.
.
"I was only fifteen when I first attempted suicide, and I was diagnosed with clinical depression. This was after many years of immense pressure from school, hurtful words by my peers, and frequent quarrels at home. But when I told my psychiatrist about the violence at home, I was surprised by her shocked reaction. All along, I thought my father‚Äôs violence was normal and happened in other families.
.
Shortly after starting therapy, I began having flashbacks of being sexually abused by my father and more memories returned. The violence continued with my father hurling various objects at us and calling me useless for not being a boy. The next year, I started experiencing post-traumatic stress disorder symptoms. I attempted another suicide; the final push to act on it came after my father touched me again.
.
On my 16th birthday, I arrived at Dayspring Residential Treatment Centre and my life has never been the same. Dayspring turned out to be a strong pillar of support, helping me through difficult times in school and with my family. Even when I experienced suicidal thoughts, the staff never gave up on me and remained understanding and patient. Being at Dayspring helped me to organise my thoughts.
.
Surprisingly, when I saw my father for the first time after entering Dayspring, I was not angry at all. I felt at peace. I realised I had forgiven him. I told him that I believed he was a good person deep down. I understood: it is through forgiveness that we free ourselves and others from the invisible shackles that once held all of us down. This was when I knew how much Dayspring had changed me."
.
.
.
#dayspring #testimonytuesday #testimony #empoweringwomen #girlssupportgirls #empowerment #abusesurvivor #successstory #givingtuesday #sgcares #abusedwomen #mentalhealthawareness #family

caption: Photo shared by HCSA Community Services on January 23, 2019 tagging @comchestsg, @ncss.sg, @msfcares, and @singaporecares.
description:
How did Hana* go from resenting "this place" to calling it her home? Read her story below to find out ‚ù§Ô∏è
.
"When I was taken away from my family to live at Dayspring, I thought I would resent this place a lot and I told myself not to trust the professionals anymore. I was someone who wasn't aware of my emotions and physical well-being. I wasn't afraid of risks and even though I knew I would have to bear the consequences of doing anything against the law, the devil in me just wanted to be a rebel. The only thing that mattered to me was being cool and having a lot of friends.
.
But as time went by, I became grateful to have the chance to stay in this wonderful place as I realised it would bring great benefits not just for myself but for my family as well. I was blessed with a befriender family that journeyed by my side and taught me the importance of honest communication in the family. Everything started to change as my family and I learned how to better communicate with each other
.
Dayspring changed me into a whole new person with new values. I used to lie a lot but now I value honesty so much. I started to be more mindful and appreciative with what I was given. I started to cherish values like change, respect and equality. I believe that these values will protect me in the future as I now know how to respond when someone wants to take advantage of me. I can now think rationally and consider the consequences of my cations.
.
I no longer believe that I am weak, neither do I feel the need to prove that I am strong by putting myself in unsafe situations. Now, I tell myself: I've been through this and I'm stronger than what I believed in"
.
.
.
#hcsacommunityservices #dayspring #successstories #humansofsingapore #girlssupportgirls #empoweringwomen #girlssupportinggirls #charity #nonprofit #socialservice #testimonytuesday #truestory #communityservice #socialwork #motivation

description:
I‚Äôm guessing that most of my friends must be busy ‚Äúparking‚Äù themselves in front of their mobile phones or laptops, trying to visit as many ecommerce platforms as possible, finding out what are the best deals that have been handed out during the 11/11 special deal day.

Over the last few weeks üìÖ, my team was dabbling about what deals, promos, offers or giveaways should we be offering to ride on the wave. We know as a startup like us, we will be embarking on a suicidal track if we are to compete against the big guns with their ‚Äúdeep pockets‚Äù. We decided to fall back to the 1Ô∏è‚É£st reason why I decided to kickstart @givevouchersg üéÅ. My life journey had allowed me to chance upon many different walks of lives of others. The last work experience had at times left me with a fair bit of emotional drain. Seeing how certain people can treat another fellow human being so differently leaves me with a bitter taste. I then decide to embark into creating a project that is simple, yet meaningful; which is to use gifting as an angle to provide happiness to others. It is which @givevouchersg üéÅ was created. Our tagline is ‚ÄúGive A Gift, Build A Story‚Äù. We hope to create more stories of happiness as a smile on one‚Äôs üòä is priceless. 
Coming back to our 11/11 #GiftForGood campaign, It might not meant a lot to you or many of us, but this small gesture we are doing hopes to provide a smile to the faces of 100 families. We might not yet have the best deals, partners, resources on our platform for now. But I am proud that our team definitely won‚Äôt lose or even surpass what others are doing, that is we are true to our hearts to do what we have set upon. With this, I am hoping you can do a part to support our campaign, which you can help to brighten up 2 persons spirits; ie. the person who receive a digital gift & the person who will receive a meal voucher for your kind support! 
Check @givevouchersg account now to find out how you can play a part!

#GIVEvent #GiftAMeal #EachTransactionCounts #DoYourPart #1111deals #Target500 #pasiriscentrehawkercentre

Last Saturday I attended a course regarding domestic abuse. It was eye opening as I came to realise how prevalent abuse cases are in Singapore. We learned on how to approach this cases and what we can do to help the victims. 
A personal important lesson I learned was that there should be no judgements on the victim's suffering. The abuse may seem mild for one party but the person who had to endure it can hurt way more than you could think. 
This course was really enlightening and I'd recommend everyone to attend this course if you get the chance. - Sembian Saravanan

#SYLP2018
#FamilyViolenceTraining
#MSF
#PAVE
#BreakTheSilence

Every kid deserves to be loved.
Realm of imagination, Joy of growing up.
I believe in Unconditional love helps a child‚Äôs mental well-being. Children can be emotionally happier and free of stress. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
MSF is having an upcoming roadshows on Fostering programme.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
The Fostering Scheme aims to provide an alternative care arrangement for children who are below 18 years of age and are in need of a safe, stable and nurturing home. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Foster care offers children the opportunity to grow in a normal family environment. Foster families embrace vulnerable children and provide food, shelter, clothing and love to children who are in need. There are many reasons why these children are in need of foster care ‚Äì their parents could have passed away, been incarcerated, or they could have been victims of abuse or abandonment. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
For those who are keen may wish to find out more: ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Date: Mon, 16 Jul to Wed, 18 Jul 2018
Time: 10:30am ‚Äì 7:30pm‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

We really liked the idea and experience of camping when we first had a chance to set up a 8pax tent last dec.
.
gotten a small tent recently from @decathlonsg at only $29.90 so we can use it as and when we‚Äôre by the park and it‚Äôs so easy to setup (literally 2 poles across the white base and just flip over the green cover) the kids love it coz it‚Äôs their ‚Äúlittle house‚Äù! Saw ritz Carlton using the same in their hotel room as glamping.
.
it‚Äôs so idyllic here at pasir ris park. Huge children playground for various ages, uncrowded beach, shower facilities (so important to freshen up after all the sweat!), boardwalks (so beautiful over that area), tracks for cycling/ skating and the PA #waterventure is just next to it with rock climbing and kayaking available.
.
The best part is my fav. ice cream uncle who is always there to sell the $1 cone ice cream. Have you visited Pasir Ris Park before? GO go go!

‚ÄúFill your life with adventures, not things. Have stories to tell not stuff to own‚Äù
.
Having kids doesn‚Äôt mean our spirits of adventure stops. As Kate and Jake grows older, we‚Äôre able to introduce and slowly involve the kids by taking them on an adventure with us. (*much like living the cartoon ‚Äì dora the explorer) It builds their character, exposure and its really fun not just for them but for us adults as well
.
Whilst we‚Äôre still ‚Äúyoung‚Äù and able, why don‚Äôt we challenge ourselves to take on activities or hobbies out of our comfort zone, even best when its done together with family to foster bonds and create wonderful memories to look back on and laugh at. There‚Äôs never a good time to start and we‚Äôre just constantly tired. if not now, when?
.
A reminder to self: To be spontaneous in life and plan to get outdoors more often!

description:

Doctor said it‚Äôs nothing serious, and his lungs are clear so she asked us to just monitor and offer some paracetamol to soothe his teething.
.
This led me to thinking, kids and babies can‚Äôt really look after themselves - that‚Äôs why as parents and caregivers, we have the responsibility to take care of them and nurture them to the best we can.
.
[#sp] Motherhood is really a journey, and there‚Äôs no turning back. But for some families, when they are unable to care for their own children - agencies like @msfcares have to help the young find an alternative, a suitable family to temporarily foster and give the child a loving place to feel safe and secure.
.
The Fostering Scheme aims to provide an alternative care arrangement for children who are below 18 years of age and if you could kindly take a look at the #MSF page, (link in bio above) please try to spread the word so we can help in any way we can. Or drop by the Foster care roadshow, happening this 11 to 13 May 2018 at 11am to 9pm at City Square Mall Level 1 (Outside Toast box) üôèüèª‚ú®
.
I wish for all kids to be happy. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Giving back to the community while serving the nation - it was in this spirit of giving back that the Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) and Ministry of Defence (MINDEF) raised more than $3 million for the Community Chest (ComChest) over the last year.
.
At the Community Chest Awards ceremony held at the Istana this evening, a total of 142 SAF/MINDEF units and departments were presented with the annual SHARE Award in recognition of their significant contributions through SHARE, a monthly donation programme under ComChest. .
This year, a total of 406 awards were given out to top donors who contributed close to $35 million in 2016. The donations will go towards supporting about 80 social service organisations.
.
Kudos to all the donors for their contributions! üëèüèª
.

description:
If you haven't heard yesterday, Minister Tan Chuan Jin was nominated to be the speaker of parliament while relinquishing his other portfolios. Thankfully, he will remain as the president of Singapore National Olympic Council. At the games, Min Tan would always mingle with the supporters and cheer from the stands. Action speaks louder than words, and at the end of the day, your heart and passion will set you will in the right direction.

This shot of @chuanjin1 was made at Bukit Jalil stadium at the 4x100 events. He moved away from the Singapore contingent and closer to the race track while cheering his heart out. I didn't understand why in the 2015 General elections his GRC was the only team not to have a rally. I finally understood; it was always about the hearts and minds.

description:
#MailboxMonday ‚Äì 2,000 people, many well-wishes, and one fantabulous birthday celebration! üéÇüéâ
.
As Singapore turns 52, the Labour Movement gathered together on 8 August to celebrate the nation‚Äôs birthday at our NTUC‚Äôs annual National Day Observance Ceremony (NDOC) at Our Tampines Hub.
.
With performances from Young NTUC's pLaY! and nEbO talents,  it‚Äôs a joyous family affair as we basked in song and festive cheer with attendees from our growing network of affiliated unions and associations, U Associates (professional guilds and associations), U SME partners (small and medium-sized enterprises' SME bosses and HR personnel), U FSE partners (freelancers and self-employed), Labour Movement communities and NTUC Social Enterprises.
.
But wait‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs not all. Did you spot us during the National Day Parade (NDP)?
.
Kudos to the NTUC Marching Contingent flying our NTUC flag high at the parade! üá∏üá¨
.
Fun fact: Did you know that NTUC has been in every NDP marching contingent since 1965, making this our 52nd time? üòÆ
.
Want to find out more about the happenings at this year‚Äôs NDOC and NDP?  Grab a copy of the latest issue of #NTUCThisWeek now!
.

caption: Photo shared by Trybe on April 11, 2017 tagging @baeyyamkeng, @youthcorpssg, and @msfcares.
description:
Received the #Daretocare tag from @msfcares! #Daretocare is a challenge to carry out an act of care or saw someone do the same and tag 3 other people to do so. 
An act of care does not have to be difficult. Our recent empowerment camp together with Ngee Ann Poly saw a group of Year 1 and 2 students reaching out to the clients from Sunlove Home and Christian Outreach to the Handicapped. 
Trybe‚Äôs chosen act of kindness is the moment during the camp when we saw one of the students, whom despite facing rejection, continued to persevere, care and encourage the client to eat. We were so happy to see the duo eventually warm up to each other. We love seeing the youths‚Äô big hearts and that is why we do what we do!

Tagging @youthcorpssg, @cctgyc and @baeyyamkeng

caption: Photo shared by Women's Football in Singapore on December 08, 2016 tagging @dipnalim, @chelseannsim, @mickylinqy, @baeyyamkeng, @netballsingapore, @mccysg, @sportcares, @sporeathletics, and @msfcares.
description:
GIRL POWER: SportCares hosted a one-day football camp themed ‚ÄúPlay Like a Girl, Break The Silence | Against Family Violence" earlier today. Singapore Athletics star Dipna Lim Prasad, ex-Netball Singapore captain Micky Lin, national taekwondo exponent Chelsea Sim, Parliamentary Secretary (Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth - MCCY) Baey Yam Keng È©¨ÁÇéÂ∫Ü and Deputy Chief of Mission, U.S. Embassy Singapore, Stephanie Syptak-Ramnath, were there to lend support to some 130 low-income girls and young women from various community groups.

The event was held in partnership with the Ministry of Social and Family Development and the U.S. Embassy Singapore.

Source: TODAY Sports
Photos: Jason Quah/TODAY, Lim Yong Teck/SportCares

description:
Happy Friday peeps! Heartfelt #thankyou to @kidsfest_singapore for this lovely shoutout! We're getting really excited as December approaches! Mummies and Daddies have you signed up for an exciting time of crafting while bonding with your little ones? Hurry! Details as follows:

DIY your very own adorable Santa and Elf Hat Candy Jars to store the candylicious treats we have in store for you! What's more, parents are able to join your kids too, where greater bonds are fostered. 
Registration ends on 28 November 2016, Monday at 2359hrs. For enquiries, contact Tiffany at asmtiffany@safra.sg. 
Venue: SAFRA Punggol
Date: Sat, 3 Dec 2016, 10 Dec 2016, 17 Dec 2016
Time: 6pm - 7pm
Fees: $27 (SAFRA member), $32 (Guest) / per 1 parent and 1 child
*Fees are inclusive of 7% GST.
Age Group: Suitable for age 3 to 12

caption: Photo shared by SingaporeMotherhood on January 21, 2016 tagging @msfcares.
description: Neglect. Abandonment. Abuse. Family Violence. In Singapore, many children and youths are unable to remain with their parents. These children are in critical need of safe and loving foster homes to belong to. More than just a roof over their heads, foster families provide these children with care, nurturance and a safe and conducive home environment to thrive in. If you have a love for children and are looking for an opportunity to make a difference, come down to a roadshow to find out how you can help change the lives of these children at the Fostering Service Roadshow. It's taking place at Junction 8 till this Sunday, 24 January 2016. Time: 11am - 9pm daily. Hotline: 6354 8799 üì∑: MSF. #singaporemotherhood #smlife #sm #mothers #motherhood #parents #sgmums #sgmothers #children #child #family #kids #families #fostering #foster #fosterfamilies #events #sgevents #roadshow #touchalife #sgig #sg
